For a lot of people , travel by your own car is more comfortable than travel by public transport like bus or the metro , because you do not depend on a schedule , that it is very common when you take public transport .
On the other hand , travelling by metro or bus pollute less than going by car .
In my opinion , there are more people who travel by car every day , even for short journeys .
The consequence of this is that , in the near future , the public transport will disappear .

Do we need fashion ?
Fashion , is a popular topic .
We all wear clothes , do n't we ?
What happens when we all just have to wear the same clothes ?
Do we really need fashion ?
In the following paragraphs I 'll tell you what they told me .
This question made the other group doubt a bit , and they did agree that a company does n't just start making something to have something to do .
This made them all agree that fashion is there for a reason , and not only for money .
There is an immense group of girls who really want to be a model , caused by the fact that they do n't fit in this clothing yet , they have to lose weight .
Much girls are losing too much weight right then because they want to be ' perfect ' , and got anorexia and those things .
Here they all directly responded with a ' yes ' too .
In their opinion , young people , also themselves , were very busy with fashion and clothes .
An example on which they all agreed was:'In case you just met your new class , and you had to choose next to who you had to sit , the most people were going to sit next to the girl or boy with the trendy clothes ' .
Some said that it even happened that people just bought a particular kind of clothing , just because they thought they would have more friends then .
The next question was:'Does it make society materialistic and competitive ? '
They all said it kind of did affect . them however , they also bought clothes they liked .
They all said yes , but with a little doubt .
So , we do kind of need fashion .
And do you have to like your clothes or someone else 's ?
Maybe we should keep in mind that we should wear clothes in which we feel okay .

Belarus is not a popular tourist destination nowadays , but a lot of people would be surprised to find the real medieval atmosphere in Grodno , a western city of the country .
Founded in the 12th century , it came through all the important events of Eastern Europe history , from the Tatar invasions till the World War II , which was a real disaster .
Two ancient castles remind us of the times of kings and nobility , quiet pedestrian streets show us the life as if it could be in the 1800s .
Grodno is situated on the crossroads of great trading ways that 's why one could hear Polish , Jewish , German , and Lithuanian there .
It 's worth visiting because the traditions of the ancient Belarusian , Tatar , Russian , Jewish being shown alive make us feel history itself .
A city of different religions , different nationalities and " talking stones " is waiting for you .
REPORT ON SHOPPING FACILITIES IN MY TOWN
The reason Lagos remains a mega city is because of its abundant tourist centers .
The beautiful seaside and natural games reserve , or Zoo makes it very attractive to tourist visitors .
ATTRIBUTES OF SHOPPING FACILITIES
There are lots of shopping centers in my town with their own unique characteristics .
These include facilities like ample vehicle parking lots with very low charges or almost free of charge , elevator systems to access any area of the shopping malls in the case of carrying very heavy loads of purchases , and relaxation spots like Cinemas and gaming centers for kids .
SHOPPING RECOMMENDATIONS
Besides , this shop is not too far from the known natural games reserve in the Lekki area of Lagos .
Another shopping center is the magnificent Lagos Island market .
I will rather advice tourist to pay this market a visit to enable them to have choices of priceless products .
CONCLUSION
I hope from the explanations , I have been able to convince you with respect to my opinion about the shopping centers in my town and their possible facilities , that abounds as you take your time in considering visiting them .
In developed countries , four wheels gain high appreciation in everyday transportation .
In the capital cities of Europe one can easily notice how many people prefer their own means instead of the pushing crowd of public transportation .
It is , however , well known after a plethora of scientific publications that cars harm the environment dramatically .
On the other hand , modern citizens like to be part of the green revolution and our carbon footprint has an effect in everyday decision making .
As a result , before private transportation reaches its pick for the 21st century , it is more probably green mobility overlaps it and dominates in people 's choice .
There is a great future for public transport , the same as for bicycling and on foot travelling instead of cars and other polluting machines .

I have always believe I can become an engineer and computer technician to invent more things since I was small .
After I receive more and more information about some successful engineer and inventor such as Steve Jobs , I realize that , no matter who you are and how smart you are , you can not live without a healthy body .
Consequently , I believe physical development is the necessity in secondary school life and I was so grateful to for providing me with opportunities of extra - curricular activities .
I like the feeling of getting sweat and have a great passion in swimming .
Therefore , to maintain my body healthy and my interest , I keep on joining the School Aquathon since I was in the secondary one . I participated the same events each year .
It allows me to know my body 's state and whether I have relapsed .
Besides , it gave me a motion to train harder and never have a thinking of giving up , and that I need to keep up my swimming training every year and reminds me of the importance of a healthy body .
I learnt how to setting a proper goal as it is a significant factor to success .
I realized that you will make a concession if you do not improve after take part in the School Aquathon and saw others got improved but not just me .
School work and examinations gave me huge pressure , so I found a way to strike a balance that I learnt playing windsurfing .
On that day , I found something wrong with my position on the result board . I was shocked and decided to protest for the wrongdoings of the race committee .

It is a fact that the public transport is getting worse year by year , specially here in Peru , however we have to think about the benefits that public transport has , for instance , it can be a cost - effective way to get to work , so there will be no space for public transport in the future ?
Hundreds of people take buses at any time , and one of the main reason for this is that they have not got their own car .
It 's known that over the years the system have improved and new means of transport have been offered , such as trains and trolleys , all of them with just one objective : to transport a mass of people at a quick time .
On the other hand , the number people who can afford a car and the cost that it involves have gone up over the last few years , and one of the main reasons they have it is because of the comfort , also they claim that they can get to their work faster than by public transport .

The girl accepted the chocolate with a smile and asked him where he was going ?
This is how they start their conversation and , while exchanging conversation , they felt as if they know each other for a long time ... they got attracted towards each other and in the midst of that they kissed each other and even exchanged phone numbers .

Secondly , people who use public transport are safer than others who use private cars ; if they drink more than usual and drive their cars ; there are a lot of car accidents due to drivers are drunk .
Finally , the traffic jam is much less if people use public transport than using private cars ; the developed countries have built a public transport system so as to avoid traffic jam , why people not using it ?
In conclusion , public transport will not be affected by using private cars .
I strongly believe that , in the near future , public transport will be the main vehicle to travel around the world , safe and cheap .

Thriller name : Killer shadow
The review :
Jack Pollard , a street fighter known as Crazy dog lives in downtown LA .
He has enemies who want to kill him .
One night when he is walking aimlessly in a privacy alley , he sees a shadow which gradually comes to him .
At first , he does n't care but suddenly he sees it in front of him , an owner - less shadow .
He turns his head around to find the source of the shadow but ca n't find anything , so he feels fear but controls himself and yells : who are you ?
Hey , if it 's a kidding , stop it , it 's not funny .
Suddenly , the shadow covers him and crazy dog falls on the ground and dies .
The police announced checkout is the murder motivation .
A detective named James Reilly wants to find out the reason for the murder and to arrest the murderer .
He realizes crazy dog killed an innocent man named Joe Mendez last year , but his body was not found .
In Mendez 's house in the suburb , Reilly found some old photos showing the sequel of criminals .
Suddenly , he hears a weak voice whispering ; do not try to stop the shadow , let it kill the criminals or you 'll die .
He checks everywhere but ca n't find anyone .
He sees a shadow out of the house and follows it until it stands at the end of a graveyard .
He goes there and sees a pile of garbage , quickly brushes aside it and observes a hole in the ground .
He goes inside it and discovers a half - decayed body that was compatible with Mendez 's identities .
He understands that the shadow was the ghost of Mendez who wanted to take revenge on Mendez 's murderer .
I think since this idea is creative , people will like to watch it .

She loves him and any World War was able to separe them , because she was pregnant and this baby was coming , it was a boy and his name was going to be Taylor , just like Jasons ' father .
Alison took a pen and a piece of paper and wrote an answer for Jason , as fast as she could , because the postman was leaving in one hour .
She was so excited and happy , she did n't kwen what could she write for her lover , she noticed that he was alive so she just wrote ' Dear , please take care of yourself , we will be here waiting for you , i 'm pregnant , it 's a boy , if you let me choose , his name will be Taylor as was your fathers ' name , I have always loved you and I always will , do your best , come back as soon as you can , because I need you , love Alison ' .
She could n't stop smiling because she had just noticed that she would n't be alone anymore .

The purpose of this report is to describe the shopping facilities in Pamplona , and to outline some recommending shops that might appeal to tourists with different interests .
Shopping Facilities
Within the town centre itself there is a wide selection of stores offering local crafts , fashion clothing , food or wine .
There is also an extensive local bus network in order to provide services to all the suburbs around the city .

My town is a very good town for taking care of the environment .
My town , City X , is a very green city .
Only cool and good cars are allowed .
People will be fined if they throw garbage on the streets .
This town is a very strict town .
Our town is full of green plants everywhere : in the school playground , between the roads and many other places .
Smoking is not allowed .
Farting in the open air is not permitted .
Plastic substances should be reused .
Plastic bags should be bought in shops .
Most people use leather or fabric bags for their everyday life .
Dogs are also not allowed because they fart and are not clean .
People with dogs will be sentenced and will suffer heavy consequences .
People who smoke will be jailed for 20 years .
City X helps reforestation in many countries and places such as Brazil , Java , Sumatra , Peru , Guyana , French Guyana , Surinam , Bolivia , Uruguay , Paraguay , Colombia , Venezuela , Equador , Chile , Indonesia , Bali , Malaysia , Singapore , India , and many more .

Then you must visit my city , Milan .
Then you must visit Venice , the city on the water where every part of the city is a little treasure .
If you like the Egyptian story , you can go to Tourin , where you can find a huge and beautiful museum about Ancient Egypt .
If you want to visit the South part of Italy , you must start your trip from Florence , the bithplace of the culture , then you must go down to Rome , the capital city of my country .
After that you have seen the Coliseum , the Basilic of S.Peter and the Trevi fountain , and so on , you must visit Naples .
In that wonderful city , you must visit the statue of Jesus Christ called " il Cristo velato " made by marble , and then you must visit the centre of the city , full of fantastic features that make this city really particular , like Spaccanapoli , Hidden Napoli , S.Gennaro 's treasure , S.Severio Church and so on .

Personally , I disagree with the view that the money is the most important consideration for deciding a job , because there are several factors equally important .
I believe that other considerations are as important as money .
Firstly , the core values and the reputation of the company are necessarily concerned .
Working in a company which is built up with good core values and has an excellent reputation could easily obtain the fulfillment and keep passion in your job for a long time .
Secondly , the co - worker relationship and the atmosphere in the workplace are extremely important when choosing a job .
Furthermore , we may need much more money to have some activities , such as worldwide travel or outdoor camping for days .
In addition , in the life - long consideration , health - care would be increasingly important with people getting older , hence having enough amount of money as a stable income could not be disregard .
In conclusion , while salary still plays a role and certainly affects people 's choice of profession , I believe that money does not outweigh all the other factors .
There are various reasons why I am absolutely fascinated by this martial art .
Behind every single movement you will find gracefulness and power .
Especially in our hectic world , it is very important to find to yourself and just listen to your body .
As a martial artist , you start to get a great fitness and your balance will improve a lot , as well as your flexibility .
Many characteristics will increase immensely , such as confidence , self - defense or responsibility .
Karate can be started by anyone and at any age .
However , to see any improvements you should attend regularly and at least twice a week .
Only then does it starts to make great fun and you certainly will not regret that you have taken it up . Enjoy ! !

All about me
Hello ! My name is Emma and I 'm 13 years old .
Now I am going tell you some facts about myself and my life .
I was born here in Sweden , actually right here at Danderyds hospital , but I lived in the city back then .
When I was about three years old , we moved here , to Danderyd .
I lived in a yellow house , not far away from where I live now ( probably just five minutes ) until a year ago , when we moved to a much bigger house .
I live here with my wonderful family based on my mum , Aylin , my dad , Tom , my two really annoying brothers , Hans and Oliwer , and my two cats , Tiger and Smilla .
Hans is 10 years old and Oliwer is 7 years old .
In the middle of the summer we always go to Gotland and stay at a farm , in a little house .
I go by cycle to " Fribergaskolan " every day , together with my friends Tekla , Julia and Bianca .
I really think it is a great school with very kind teachers and students .
I like to dance a lot .
On Monday and Thursday , I dance at a dance - school here , close to " Mörby Centrum " , called C - style .
I dance a mixture of street dance and show dance .
Right now , I 'm actually in a riding course every Sunday .
I really like Spain , we have been there , like , six times and the reason is that my dad has a project there and sometimes he has to go there for a week or less and we have the luck to be able to join him .
I really like to eat sushi and other Asian food , like noodles .
My favorite restaurant is a restaurant in Stockholm at Östermalm called : " New Peeking " . It 's an Asian buffé and they make the best food .
My favorite book is right now : " The fault in our stars " , because its a really good subject and it is sad but a great story .
My favorite movie is maybe " TED " or " Grown ups " because they are really fun movies with some sad moments .
On the holidays and after school , I 'm often with my friends and family .
I have got one own camera , it 's a Canon .
The biggest accident in my life was probably when I was three years old .
It was midsummer and my mum was outside on the terrace .
I wanted to go out to her , so I open the door on the wrong side by putting my long finger and ring finger in the little crevice .
Suddenly , a powerful wind make the door blow up and squeeze my finger really hard .
My fingers were almost cut , off so my dad wrapped my fingers in a bandage and we drove to the doctor as fast as we could .
They had to sew my finger , but in the end , everything went fine .
And today I have got normal fingers .
I like animals very much and I want to become a vet when I get older . I have got a lot of animals in my life .
Three words who describe me best : committed , animal lover , loyal friend .
Emma Öberg 7A3
I live in Camden .
In camden , every block counts with three or four containers to recycle paper , plastic , glass and old clothes .
Also , every flat or house has a recycling bag to recycle paper and a plastic container to recycle organic waste .
The council recollects , once a week , door to door , paper and organic waste .
There has been an extensive campaign to limit the amount of water used to water plants and to wash cars .

Teach us how to love .
Friendship is one of the most valuable sentiments for people , especially for people who are in their school days .
Making new friends and sharing interests with others are always an exciting parts of social life .
First of all , for the energetic students , doing sports is their favorite activity .
Therefore , joining a sports team from where they can share same interests and relax is the easiest way to get to know each other .
Training in the same sports team , the students can not only release them from the whole day 's pressure , but also can build up good relationships with others through the communication and exercise .
For example , the champions of the Olympic Games , China 's famous synchronized diving athletes , GuoJingjing and Wu Minxia , the two girls enjoy a really good friendship .
Additionally , cooperation and coherency are always the main essence of a sports team .
Here , students learn how to work together , how to fight for the same goal through tacit teamwork , how to contribute to the whole team instead of just thinking of self , and even how to negotiate or discuss with others , as well as how to be patient and rational .
Although there may be some argument or disagreement among students , I always think that everything is going to be okay because the sports team will be coherent .

Take care ,
José Luís .

I think the most beautiful building that I have visited is the " Monumento a La Bandera " .
It was built on June 20 , 1957 and was built by the architect and engineer Angel Guido to celebrate the Flag Day .
It has a tower of 70 meters with a viewpoint on the top , and it is famous for its big flag and the crypt in tribute to Manuel Belgrano .
Inside the " Monumento a La Bandera " you can see historical objects about the history of Argentina , and in the underground it 's the hall of honor of American Flags .
If you want to enter to the hall of honor or enter to the monument , it 's free , but if you want to go up to the viewpoint , unless you are younger than 5 , you must pay an entrance fee of 10 $ argentines .
The building is open from 9:00 to 19:00 every day .

In recent years , social media sites have developed and interpenetrated our society as the essentials rapidly .
There are enormous numbers of users all over the world , and social media sites such as Twitter , Facebook and YouTube are utilized for acquiring some information , contributing ideas , sharing photographs and communicating between individuals , between individuals and organization or between organizations .
Bulgarian parents can choose when their children start school- at 6 or 7 years old .
Before they start school , they have to finish preschool .
Usually children go to kindergarten up to 5 years old , and after that , they start preschool .
In this case they start school at 6 years .
Some children start school at 7 years old , it depends on when they are born - at the beginning or near the end of the year .
The Bulgarian school year starts in the middle of September .
So , if the child is born in the first few months of the year , parents can choose when their child will start school , at 6 years and a few months or 7 years and a few months .
Most Bulgarian parents are not agree with their children to start school at 6 years old .
However , the Bulgarian government was thinking about change the law so all children have to start at 6 years old .
I think I ca n't compare the education of children in school or tertiary education between Bulgarian and Australia , because I still do n't have children and I am not studding in university in Australia .
Let me introduce you to my hometown , Kortrijk .
It is also the Dutch speaking part of Belgium .
Kortrijk is nearby the French border , about 15 minutes away by car .
It was built in the 11th century and is well known for its shopping area .
You can choose between several types of food , such as Japanese , Italian , French and many other food .
Of course , you can eat the typically Belgian dish mussels with French fries .
The concerts attract many people from all over Belgium .
Now Kortrijk is changing a lot .
In the last few years , a lot of building has been done in the area .
New bridges have enriched the town .
Dear Sir or Madam ,
last week , I was on holiday with my family in your " New Holiday Village " .
Unfortunately , our holiday did not live up to the claims made by you .
We had a number of problems ; the first one is concerning the number of beds : You offered space to sleep for six persons , so we excepted six bed , but we only had five .
So , two of us had to share one bed , which is hardly acceptable .
The other problems is about the offered excursions : You promised a number of attractions , but two ( the walk up to the mountain , as well as the visit of a historic castle ) were not available .
Unfortunately , we also had problems with nutrition : In your brochure it was told that we will have a number of restaurants around , but in fact there was only one , which was , in addition to that , really expensive .
We are of the opinion that you should not offer things which are in fact not available .
It requires a rich imagination to try to put a view of the future , first of all , the means of transport will change , depend mainly on the solar energy or the nuclear energy , a flying public transport bus will be a fast ride to work , you will need to supply your car with spinache after they invent a spinache - using car .
Also , the food will change in the future , capsules of your favourite foods will be available at the future in the mobile supermarkets , these capsules will turn into your lunch as soon as you put a small amount of water on it .
In the future , water will be very expensive to the extent that you will have to work three hours of overtime everyday to be able to pay for half a liter of clean water , but the one thing that will never change in the future is the smile on your mother 's face when you surprise her by cleaning your bedroom without using the robot that belongs to your older brother .
Of course , I think that we should n't watch too much television .
I think that we should promise ourselves that we will just watch maximal 1 hour 's TV every day .

This year is the last one before going to university .
After so much time at school , some people think they need a break .
On one hand , it is true that leaving school means passing from the basis to your future profession .
However , it could be a great time to work and earn some money for paying university or simply for saving it .
On the other hand , maybe if we have a break until university , the routine of working and studing every day could break .
So when univerity starts , people will become busy , the routine will not be the same , and , as a consecuences the marks will be lower .
to conclude , I think after school we need to apply for university in order to continue working in what we like .
The year off should be taken after university studies .
As the number of traffic accident has increased dramatically over the year , finding the best solutions has putted the government under pressure as to whether to implementing stricter penalties or using alternative regulations .
Personally , road safety can not be ensured with either the former or the later methods .
Instead , it should be a combination of various actions .
As a matter of fact , severe punishments can partly decrease the rate of offences .
Moreover , one 's penalty also can be considered as a mirror that people can look at and avoid doing the same things .
The main offences are driving over the speed limits , drunk driving , driving without licences .
Consequently , those punishments make the drivers have to concentrate on driving only , and therefore , minimize the amount of accidents .
By the same token , a sole method could not solve the traffic problems , as driving offences are not the only reason that cause traffic accidents .
In many developing countries , the government rarely attach special important to both the quality and quantity of the traffic system , especially in rural areas .
Furthermore , vehicle collisions are rising greatly due to the number of unclear road signs .
People should be educated carefully about all the safety regulations and laws when they get their driving licence , the more they know the rules , the less risks are taken on the road .
Public transportation once used to be a convenient and inexpensive way to transport oneself in the city .
However , the increasing number of car ownership has been taken place of public transportation , providing more convenience to get around places and to places .
We do not have to concern to catch a bus or train at a certain time .
However , cars can not take the place of public transportations just for that convenience .
In addition , cars require regular maintenance , such as oil change and checking tire pressures .
Not to mention that not everyone can afford keeping a car with their budget .
In other perspective , cars require to drive .
Driving is something not everyone can do .
For example , people who have disabilities and certain diseases are not able to drive .
Children under a certain age are not permitted to drive .

We want all our children to go to this camp , so we set up a donation project .
The greater amount of money has already been collected thanks to the trustee board of " NNN " community , but we still need an additional $ 13000 .
We are asking you not to stay indifferent to disabled children and to provide feasible help .

On the other hand , newspapers are presented in a definite place , with limited time , and in addition , they are daily payable .
While some may claim that credibility is the main reliable aspect of publishing .
In this respect , newspapers seem to be more credible than numerous websites that make up fake stories much more than publishing real news .

In light of the forgoing discussion , it appears to be true that the internet is an incredible aspect toward globalisation even in daily news worldwide .

These days , the use of technology is increasing , especially the use of robots .
According to Russell and Norwing , robots are especial machines that have intelligence to executed activities on their own or by command ( as cited in Chijindu & Inyiama , 2012 ) .
They represent an innovation that has changed the world in distinct ways and have been implanted in different areas of society ; for example in security , health , the army forces , education , industries and agriculture .
Consequently , positive and negative social impacts can be observed by the population .
More accurate surgeries , emotional bond and an increase of communication are examples of positive consequences .
Negative impacts , such as the human dependence on robots for doing basic activities and pollution of the environment , can be cited .
As we know , in all cities , a lot of cars are used every day unnecessarily .
Probably , if we used up public transport like bus instead of private vehicles , we would reduce the greenhouse effect because of the CO2 produced .
Sometimes , cities get rid of rubbish by throwing it to the water .
An easy answer could be building more landfills .
Last , I 'll propose a solution of a common and near problem .
Reusing things that we do n't utilize any more ( like clothes , furniture … ) and give them a ' second life ' .
I think we must be down to earth and creative to cut down on our daily trash 's production .
To sum up , it 's necessary to solve the environmental problems to keep safe our planet , so we had better start resolving closer issues .

She was going to the national championships in swimming , she was preparing since last summer .
Taking part in it and gaining the best place was her biggest dream .
Especially since the previous national competitions when she suffered a shoulder injury and could not start .
After all , this is a hard work from an early age and on the list of players does not enter by accident .
Dressed in a swimsuit , she was waiting in front of a swimming pool for the next judges ' command .
The judge ordered them to take place at the sites .
Anna looked again toward the audience , where her the best fans in the world were sitting - her parents , friends , coach and friends .
She swam so fast , like a former fish , not a human being .
Only after a while , after a few quick and short breaths occurred to her that she had fulfilled her biggest dream .

Speaking English is becoming essential for students and workers .
For this reason , school of English are opening in all the big cities as well as in most towns .
Anyway , it must be taken into account that English courses are often very expensive , and you have to study in a constant way to improve class by class .
On the one hand , living abroad will be probably non cheap , so it could be needed to find a job , but it would be at the same time an advantage : working with English people would help you improve quickly your speaking and listening .
On the other hand , living abroad , you 'll need to speak English all the time and you 'll have the opportunity to learn English in a short time , and in a not boring way .
So , probably , if you have the opportunity to stay abroad for several months , you should do it , to learn English and live a different experience .
TIPS FOR TOURISTS
The aim of this report is to give some advice to all of you who like shopping .
In order to improve the time you spend on it , we will recommend you to star in one of ours malls , where you can find at your disposal several facilities , from the most fashionable shop to the most traditional .
First of all , coming to a mall will help you to deal with them , also , we have to rate positively the wide range of services you can find here : restaurants , coffee shops and some free areas to spare .
Another advantage is that you will find most of the shops you can find in the city centre but you wo n't get lost while you search for them .
For all of you who have kids , you will also be interested in the different areas which take care of them for free for as much time as you need .
I would strongly recommend this at the nap time , to allow them to relax , otherwise you will have to leave sooner than you expected .
In conclusion , you will save , time , money and a foot ache . So accept my advice and try to enjoy the rest of the time of the city .

Do we need the internet to enjoy life to the full ?
Internet has been developed a lot for the last few years , and we can use it easily for doing any tasks .
On the positive side , the use of the internet helps us to find easily and quickly a lot of information that talk about all the topics .
What is more , we can only have to press one computer key to find what we are searching for .
For this reason , the most people have the Internet at home .
On the negative side , the use of the Internet can be a waste of time in our lives ; this happens because although search is faster , we can distract looking at other things on account of the attractive of the Internet .
Following the above argument , this is the danger of spend hours and hours surfing the web and not being in the real world enjoying the live .
To sum up , the Internet is a good and efficient instrument if we know the correct use of it .
Nowadays , it is very frequent to meet new person coming from abroad who speak different languages and speak about their home countries .
But to learn new cultures , we must know their languages , especially if we want to travel .
Due to globalization , there are more and more multinational companies that require employees who can speak at least fluent English , but if a candidate knows more languages he can have more career chances and achieve top level positions .
In my opinion , it is very important to speak several languages , not only for the above reasons , but also to train your brain , to have the opportunity to find a job abroad and , why not ?
Unfortunately , it is very difficult to learn foreign languages when we are adult , so it is extremely important to teach and to study them since kindergarten age .

I went to a workshop about the light - controlled synthesizer .
To get to the place they were holding the workshop in , you had to come to the Chester Beatty library and then the guides arrived and led you to it .
On the way there , everyone who participated in the workshop stopped to buy some snacks .
We were told to choose biscuits and the guides paid for us .
When we reached the workshop , the kids and I were told to put on protective glasses and given booklets with the instructions .
We were taught how to solder two wires together and how to solder a wire to a vero board .
Then we had to follow the instructions in the booklet to make the synthesizer .
At first I was quite confused , but then one of the instructors came and helped me out .
After that , we had a snack and then went on to assemble all the parts together .
We put them in metal boxes and turned them on .
Each synthesizer emitted a loud noise .
When the light sensor is in the shade , the synthesizer emitts a lower pitch , and when the sensor is exposed to light , the synthesizer 's pitch raises .

I had to work as a liase with clients as well as the company officials ( since Shriram Law Consultants is a part of the Shriram Group of Companies ) .
The author claims that the main aim of the scientists is to reduce human suffering even if it demands research conducted on animals .
Firstly , the author informs us about the impossibility to discover new types of drugs .
Secondly , the author suggests that it is impossible to replace experiments on animals with anything else .
The lecturer disagrees with that point of view , because it is possible to introduce computer substitution or do research on tissues .
Thirdly , the author considers that such tests to keep animal suffering to a minimum .
The lecturer argues that , as a biologist , she used to see animals suffering without the appropriate amount of anesthesia .
The article states that the most efficient substituer of internal - combustion engines will be fuel - cell engines , because of their several advantages , while the lecture refutes this point by stating that hydrogen does not have so many advantages .
First of all , the reading passage says that the internal - combustion engine relies on petroleum , which will be depleted soon , but hydrogen will not deplete easily .
She adds that it is not directly usable , because hydrogen should be obtained in a pure liquid state , which technologically is very hard to be kept under -200 degrees celsius .
Finally , the article says that the use of hydrogen is highly economic , because it requires only half of the energy of internal - combustion - powered cars .
She explains that platinum is very hard to find and , without this metal , it is impossible to produce hydrogen .
An Unexpected Success
I am a fairly calm person and I am interested in reading every kind of books , therefore , I have a quiet life .
Last Spring , however , something happened which surprised everybody , especially me .
My little sister wanted to learn to play the piano so she joined a music school which organised a concert performance at the end of the course .
I went with her and I waited for her the whole lesson .
Unfortunately , she could no longer play .
You are able to read the sheet music and I think you will learn to play the piano in a while . '
I was absolutely terrify as I had to show .
However , the teacher persuaded me to try to play the piano .
Only then did I realise that I was keen on playing .
As a result , I spent the time playing the piano until I felt far more confident .
The day of the concert , I was so nervous that I could n't stop walking .
But when I started , I relaxed and felt like I was the only person in the theatre .
At the end of the play , everybody applauded , had I never felt I so well .

Introduction :
The aim of this report is to assess the most interesting shops for tourists and make some suggestions .
Shopping facilities :
Most people are satisfied with shops in my town in spite of it being quite small .
However , the relation between the quality and the price of the products are believed to be the most essential points to visit Cáceres .
Suggestions :
In general , tourists think shops should be opened during middayas they are foreigners and like to buy things after watching the sights around the city .
It is thought that the best shops in Cáceres are found in the ancient town , as it has a medieval charming which involves visitors in that moment of the time .
Conclusion and recommendations :
Overall , the majority of the tourists prefer to buy typical products from the region and , besides , it is very enjoyable to taste a meal in San Juan Square while people walk around to see at the main clothes shops situated in the main street before to go to the heritage town .

You know that Russia is a big country and there are a lot of places to visit .
In our country there are a few different climate zones with very rich nature , and various cities with old and prominent history and culture .
I 'm pretty sure that your journey to Russia will be a very good and interesting experience .
First of all , you can come to Moscow .
In the city there are a lot of museums and art galleries , theaters and clubs , a few parks which priveds different events like open - air concerts or public muster - classes .
Of course , you must visit Red Square , the Kremlin and Saint Basil 's Cathedral .
I strongly recommend you to book on - line tickets to the Big Theater and visit it 's opera or ballet .
You know the Big Theater is one of the oldest in Russia with very rich traditions of ballet school .
Nowadays , artists of the Theater try to keep that old school and develop their mastery .
In addition , a few years ago , the Big Theater was restored and had gained it 's original appearance .
There is no necessity to describe all the sightseeing in Moscow , you easily can find it in the Internet , I just want to say that I 'm sure , you 'll like it a lot .
After Moscow , you can visit the town of the Gold Ring .

Some people claim that universities and colleges should not spend a great deal of money on sports and social activities , as their budgets should prioritize classes and libraries .
The student had a great deal of assighment and projects , so he spent more time to access the libabry , becoming more ambition to study books , and using a computer to search the for latest information .
Sometimes he felt tired to do papers , going to the gym to play basketball .
Therefore , not only did he get high score in the reports , that absorbinge a great deal of knowledge at the libabry , but he reduce the study stress and maintain healthy in the gym .
When I finished classes , I would like to access the health center , not only to do exercises , but I could maintain healthy .
At university , I also have a lot of assighments , so I like to go to the libabry to study , where it is more quietly , spacious and internet accessible .
That 's why I like to go to a school in terms of good facilities and widespread information to facilitate me to be a successful person .
Sports and social activities can greatly improve my efficiency .
Academic education will always be at the heart of a university .
In universities , sports and social activities should by no means take the place of a focus on academic study .
I believe that universities and colleges should spend adequate budget on academics as well as sports and social activities .

In the other hand , when teenagers take a year off , it is helpful for them to become mature .
You can work , travel , going to an exchange study program , rest and do something that you are interested in .
A lot of people think it is a waste of time , but that is not true .
When students enter University after they have taken a year off , fewer people leave the career after several months because they know themselves better .

Twenty years ago , no one would think of the inventions of the Ipad or smarthphone and how they could change our lives , but today , these items have become the necessities of our daily lives ; nowadays , many people have just got into the habit of carrying their smartphones no matter where they go .
The Ipad , smartphone , genetic food engineering , all of them have one thing in common -they have changed our lives dramatically .
Take genetic engineering as an example , on the one hand , it helps farmers to produce more corps and meats , on the other , it makes people believe that scientists can help in finding more efficient ways in producing more corps and poultry in the future , resulting in an unprecedent increase in the human population , which brings pollution to the environment .

CONTRIBUTION TO A LONGER PIECE
I always love writing .
I have always loved reading .
You never know what you are going to find when you are reading ( or writing ) and less if you are doing it on the Internet .
There are such an interesting websites and blogs where you can find out something very useful that you would have never expected or , unsurprisingly , missinformation .
WHY BLOGS APPEAL TO BOTH READERS AND WRITERS
Many people will find blogs and websites useful in order to meet new people .
However , on the internet you can find not only meeting points but practical and very thought - provoking articles in blogs .
In my experience , being under the screen of a personal computer , will you be able to show and exchange ideas or opinions as easily as if you have to do in front of someone else .
However , both readers and writers do not only do it as an altruistic and philantropic way , but to get fame and popularity at the same time . Blogs and websites could give them the chance to became famous if they really appeal to a large amount of people and they will abe also available to earn money thanks to the publicity .
THE BLOG I FOLLOW
To give an example , I usually follow a blog whose main task is to inform about novelties of new and old series , characters , new seasons , and when they will be ready to watch them again .
That 's the point of the Internet .
You must n't take everything into account .
To clarify what the situation is , it is truth that not everybody may be interested in blogs or websites , but the fact is writing or reading in a blog could give to people a practical way to communicate and share preferencies , beliefs or thoughts , however , more or less reliable .

Visiting museums is an essential parts of their travel to new places for many people .
Besides seeing touristic or historical places , and attending open - air activities , people also want to see the museums of the city they visited .
Because museums offer so many interesting and different things , they differ from other places in the visiting city .
First of all , people visit museums to learn the history of the visiting city . We know that museums are generally established to expose special and unique belongings which are historically valuable as well as to expose modern belongings .
These old things in the museum give us unique information about the history of the city and its social life .
For example , when you go to the Metropolitan museum of art in New York city , you can see lots of historical monuments and items belong to American history and also other countries ' history .
Observing these items , you can get an idea about the old times of the visiting place .
Secondly , museums are places from where you can learn about the culture of the visiting city .
For instance , art museums include art collections such as paintings from many different artists .
Some of them were made in the modern style and some of them in the classic .
You can get an idea of the culture of the city from these paintings .
The third advantage of visiting a museum is that you can have fun visiting a museum .
Beside historic and cultural characters , some museums also can be a source of fun , including attractive activities .
If you are bored to see classic museums , you can go to thematic museums such as a natural history museum .
In addition to having lots of information , we also can have fun to see interesting things in the museums , such as huge dinasours . You may feel incomplete if you do not visit the museum of the new place you travel .
They say it is caused by burning oil , so the society demands itself to enclose it .
It is often necessary to have a car when living in a small city or village without public transport , and it is understandable .
But while living in a big city , where there are lots of bus stops , tram stops or metro stations , it is quite incomprehensible that people want to drive their own car and be stuck at a block while rush hours .
As the ecology organisations says , it is better for the environment , and as we decided , it is better for us to save our precious time .
Increasingly , people prefer to use public transport rather than to drive a car for these reasons .
It is not true that public transport has no future .
The bigger the city is , the more important public transport is .
The importance of the internet on our lives
The last decades there has been an massive change been in our lives , this is caused by the development of the internet .
In this essay I will describe some of those effects .
In these days , a lot of student are using the internet as a study tool .
The internet allows you to search for information in massive online libraries for research and writing essays .
There are massive online libraries like Science Direct or Google Scholar to find the publications of researchers around the world .
The greatest impact of the internet on our lives is the use of social media .
Almost everybody have at this moment at least one account on a social media network like Facebook or LinkedIn .
The positive effect is that it is possible to be in contact with your friends and family whenever , wherever .
One of the downsides is that you are not able to get away from your bully .
This could drive someone crazy and make them very miserable .
The greatest impact of the internet on our life is the use of social media because you can get in contact with everybody around the clock .
Also , it gives us the possibility to get in contact with family and friends .
There are also negative effects like bullying !
I think we should use the internet carefully and keep use it with cautious .

Dear Chairman ,
I am writing to you to raise an important issue concerning the school library .
I look forward to understanding and I hope we will reach a consensus .
First of all , it is very important to me to determine the basic problem of our school .
For many years , we , pupils , have been waiting for a library .
Yet , it has still not been built .
Our priority is good preparation for the secondary school certificate .
For this purpose , we need a quiet place to learn .
Moreover , pupils demand is the possibility to borrow books .
They are simply too expensive .
Our request boils down to the fundamental role of education .
It is broadening the horizons of our knowledge .
Besides the issues that have been already mentioned , there is also the undisputed fact that if our school had a rich computerized library , it would be more representative .
Respectfully yours ,
Piotr Dudek .
But how will change the people 's life in the next 50 years ? .
That 's why we have to describe some important ideas related to this topic .
First of all , as we said before , the people 's lives have changed due to two important elements , which are the technological improvements and society changes .
The first one it is very obvious because , every day , the researchers are discovering new things and improving the scientific knowledge that allows us to create new invents and improve the old ones .
For example , one of the most important devices that has taken an important role in our lives is the mobile phone , which has changed extremely fast over the last ten years .
Another example is the cars , which are taking the same way as well as the mobile phone has done .
The second one is very important too , because society has changed a lot as well as the people 's mind .
For instance , one hundred years ago , it was impossible to see a woman working and carrying on economically the whole family alone or studying for a degree in the university , things that today are very usual and well accepted in our society .
In addition , there are other conditions and facts that has helped to change the people 's lives , such as political decisions , global wars and global economical problems , etc .

Hit and run
Do you like adventure sports ?
Or do you prefer the relaxed ones ?
If you have said yes , grass hockey is for you .
Grass hockey is a popular sport practiced among people of all ages and it 's more played in countries like Britain , Argentina or German rather than in Spain or Italy .
In order to score , you should push a small white plastic ball inside the goal using a stick .
In my opinion , grass hockey is the best sport you can play as it requieres you to be really focused on to hit the ball correctly .
Besides , when you practise it , you must move all your body , because you have to run and guide the ball through the field .
So now , if you 're thinking hockey is for you , I recommend you to buy a pair or good grass boots .
And do n't worry if you are not able with sports that involve using a tool , you can always be the goal keeper in your team .
Michael was home alone , spending time in front of the TV , watching his favourite movie .
While he was lost in the action , a strange and unexpected sound came from his sister 's bedroom .
He continued watching the movie , thinking it must be nothing .
Then there it was again , the sound .
" Hello , is someone there ? " , Michael asked .
Suddenly , a loud bang .
Michael reached for his baseball bat , ready to look into what was going on .
He tiptoed to his sister 's room , knocked silently , hoping there was no answer .
And there was n't .
He slowly opened the door , and a cat jumped right in front of him . "
A cat ?
All this was caused by a cat ?
Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake .

I do n't agree with the statement .
Indeed , it is true that travelling by car is much more convenient .
But cars need petrol .
Fossil resources are about to run out .
For the sake of that , the public transport will be improved , instead of being replaced by cars .
On the other hand , more electric cars are produced every year .
This fact could keep the share of cars .
For the above reasons , I suspect that the share of public transport do n't decrease , but will rather increase in the future .
For example , car sharing could increase in the city .

Latent fingermarks are commonly found at the scene of a crime .
Persistence and uniqueness are the characteristics of the fingerprint .
The latent form of fingermark is invisible to the human eye , hence the need for some methods for visualization and development of latent fingermarks .
Divergent approaches are used on a routine basis for the development of latent fingermarks .
Powders , by adhering physically to the fingermark residue developed the latent fingerprint , chemical reagents undergo reactions with the organic and inorganic parts of the fingermarks developing the latent , small particle reagent developed latent fingermarks by adhesion to sebaceous content of the fingermarks , ninhydrin reacting to amino acid of the fingermark and developed the latent marks , single and multi - metal deposition methods works on the principle of deposition and resulting in the negative development of latent marks .
so , starting from powders to chemicals , all are in the public eye .
New methods are continually added in the literature and shows the importance of fingerprints in the criminal investigation system .
one can easily deduce information of culprits with partial form of a latent fingermark .

Enjoying the outdoors in my area
Introduction
The purpose of this report is to propose the best places for visiting and to show the wide range of existing facilities which can be used by young people who are going to make a trip to my area .
There are many parks and green areas close to this city where young people could spend their time outdoors and having fun during all day before going out , such a park is called : San francisco , which has a big lake and local young people are used to having barbecues there , after they had done any water sport or rented a boat .
In addition , there are many public transport which could drop you off in front of the park .
We have an active Nightlife in this city , live gigs are performed from Wednesday to Sunday in several pubs with free access and our cinemas have always had a good movie listing .
In my opinion , the fame is a need for actors and musicians of the popular culture .

Soccer has always been part of your life and memories of you as a kid kicking a ball bigger than you are still vivid in my mind .

You 've kept working on it for almost your entire life now and , although you have not become a professional one , you have never given up .
However , piano is also part of your life .
When I first introduced you to it , you were quite sceptical of your possible achievements .
But again , you never gave up and now you playing in the 3rd Orchestra in Town , which shows how big you are .
Proof that not only you are very determined , but that piano playing was meant to be .
We have enjoyed music together for nearly 20 years and most of our good times are related to that .

I imagined the scenario with Mathew coming up to me and looking for some advice .
I 'd suggest we take some days off together and head for any particular place he would like to go to .
Then , once we get on the car , I 'd let the music we had planned before as the ideal background absorb us before uttering any words .
Only after driving for a while I would ask him to tell me what he 's been up to lately and if there 's anything he hasn't told me about but is keen to mention now .
At that point , I would let his talking go on without stopping him from interruption .
By now , he will be able to answer for himself many questions he 's been troubling with .
All I 'll have to do is just point out what the main points are that he is too dull to see .
Because that 's what an outside criterion is needed for .
Someone else can just help you think out and be nothing but supportive .
Perhaps the next day , he wo n't even be able to recall what the speaking was about , but I 'm pretty sure that after all this , deep down in himself he will know what the best move on is to make ! !

In fact , travelling by car is not convenient when people have their own cars for their family or themselves .
The main advantage of public transportation is that it can transport a large number of passengers at a relatively low cost .
For example , a bus can take more than 40 passengers at one time at a low cost .
For another , the subway is able to transport a number of people around the city .
Too many vehicles in a crowned city would increase the carbon dioxide emissions .
In conclusion , public transportation would still pay an important role of transportation in a city , unless the environmental vehicles are promoted by the government and the roads and highways in a city are managed well for accommodating a huge number of cars .

Some people think that computers are the most important invention over the last century , while others think that there are a lot of inventions over the history that are more important than the computer .
Personally , I think the computer brings many changes in the world , and it is for that that I think it is the most important invention .
For example , how one person can be informed about what happens to the other side of the world with only a click .
In contrast , some people think that the computer is just one more invention in the history of humanity , and although they accept that it is an important invention and changes the world , they prefer to say that there exist inventions more important than the computer that nowadays we still use .
For example , the paper or the wheel .
Overall , people are divided in what they think about the most important invention in the world and what changes these objects make to the world and humanity , I still think that the computer is the most important invention because it not only changes one part of the history like the parper or the wheel did , it changes every aspect of the human 's life .

As the only Brazilian president from an unprivileged background , Lula has made history after running for four times for President .
Since he took up the office in 2002 , Lula has made major structural changes in Brazil , taking out more than fourty million Brazilians out of extreme poverty .
To curb corruption , new laws were created , instituions were re - structured and innovative mechanisms were developed to engage and give voice to the civil society .
Minority groups received more attention to protect their rights and investments in education , health and well - being increased .
Curiously , Lula is the only Brazilian president without a university degree .
For the poorest Brazilians , Lula and his history is something to be proud of .
For the Brazilian elite it is unacceptable that Lula , a poor migrant from northern Brazil , overshadowed all the presidents and most politicians of their own , priviliged , university - educated and careless about the real Brazilian problems .

The President of the United States of America , Mackinley , says that , regarding Cuba , he will not meddle until December .
The newspaper " Times " publishes an intercepted letter written by the Spanish Ambassador , Dupuy de Lowe , that will make him resign due to what he wrote about the USA .
Next , to the blow - up of the North American steamer , Maine , the Spanish commission created to investigate this explosion assures us that it could n't be done from the outside , but must have been done from the inside .
On the other hand , the USA commission brings their results to the Parliament without previously notify their results to Spain and with the opposite conclusion to that of the Spanish commission .
Later , the USA government affirms they do not want to conquer Cuba , but they demand Spain to sign an armistice with Cubans .
The Pope requests the Spanish army to cease immediately the hostilities in Cuba .
The Spanish Ministry of State publishes a Memorandum relating all the events and conflicts made by the USA to Cuba until the publishing date .
Also , this Memorandum specifies the origin of the conflict , which resides in the letter written by Lowe and the blow - up of the steamer Maine , the latter being remarked concerning the USA having rejected the Spanish proposition to carry out the arbitrage together .
The 21st of April EEUU denies the Spanish sovereignty over Cuba , the 23rd of April , Spain sends the Memorandum to several nations and on the 25th , the USA declares the war to Spain .

Despite some people would suggest that such a service has no future because people are more rely on the car , as it is convenient , it is my personal belief that public transport should continue and has its future .
Firstly , the society today are more concerned about being environmentally friendly .
This is a worth seeing be concerned because air pollution has a negative impact on our health and the ecosystems .
The more cars on the road , the more green house gases are produced .
For example , if a bus can carry 100 passengers , at least 25 cars can be reduced on the road , solved the problem of traffic jam .
In addition , scientists and engineers are working hard to invent and improve the vehicles , so they become less harmful to the environment .
The second argument is more related to everyone and has great influence .
For those who do not drive , public transport is extremely important .
There are thousands of students who travel with public transport to school everyday because they can not drive and their parents do not have time to drive them .
Moreover , insurance , petrol , and repair fees are very expensive .
Not everyone can afford it .
In conclusion , I believe that public transport should have a future .
Professionals are continuing to develop a better vehicle to make it eco - friendly , and there are still many people who rely on public transport .

In the reading passage , the writer provides several theories about the purpose of the carved stone balls .
However , the lecturer points out the problems in all his assertions .
Firstly , the author holds that the stone balls were possibly used in hunting or fighting .
If they were used as weapons , they should be broken up or divided into pieces .
Secondly , the writer claims that the stone balls might be us as standard weights to measure things .
Nevertheless , the lecturer contends that the theory is indefensible .
It is because different stones have different densities that their weights are different , though they are uniform in the same size .
Moreover , in general , an artifact of social symbol is buried with its owner after he or she died .

Everything happened that summer I spent in Egypt .
My mother had found a new job in some ancient ruins , right in the middle of the desert . I should mention that she was an important archaeologist , known all over the world , and she had to travel to every corner on Earth .
I used to spend my whole holidays at my grandparents ' country house , surrounded by green fields , forest and rivers , but when I turned eighteen my mother thought I was old enough to take a plane on my own and stay with her for a month .
I did n't expect to find anything else than sand , heat and tourists on my way across the desert , even though I was leading myself to a patch of water among leagues of wasteland , the oasis of Faiyum .
When I managed to reach the outside , I had a taxi waiting for me , probably sent by my mother , so at least I did n't have to look for another one in the stifling heat of the city .
On the other hand , the taxi did n't even have air conditioning , so I spent the two hours of the journey trying to fan myself with a magazine I borrowed from the driver .
I reached the hotel well in the afternoon , nevertheless , the air was still oppressive and hot like at midday .
Even though I had to bear the climate , I was happy with being able to see my mother more often than I used to in past summers .

Garlic is a plant , a member of the lily family , with an odor and a taste characteristic .
The slaves , who constructed the pyramids , were fed with garlic , because the Egyptians believed that garlic would make the workers stronger , so they could work harder .
In the Roman and Greek cultures , people believed in garlic 's magic powers to avoid the Evil .
In the Middle Ages , sailors carried garlic with them to help them endure long periods in the seas .
At least 23 different types of bacteria were tested .
It can explain , too , why the use of garlic was a good option to prevent gangrene in WWI .
Another experiment demonstrated a positive effect of garlic in the blood system .
It was demonstrated that garlic has a compound that can make the blood " thinner " .
This can be used to prevent heart attack and stroke .
Therefore , include garlic in the diet can really be beneficial for health , as some cultures believed .

Secondly , I turn off the faucet and the switches when not in use .
Thirdly , I segregate my rubbish .

All in all , I think that helping our environment does n't have to be a big time . We should be aware of the fact that mother earth is irreplaceable nor irrevocable .
We have the time now to do what is necessary .
That is a small start , but it will eventually reap a huge outcome .

The picture shows clearly the process of making bank notes .
As is shown in the picture , we can obviously see that four main steps make up the process .
In this stage , they pay attention to the colour , and special ink and images slightly raised is necessary .
The last but most important step is the ispection .
In this step , the workers should be able to tell the good quality sheets from the band ones .
dispatched .

As you enter the place you are welcomed by a magnificent setting , a lot of paintings of the city .

All fast food dishes are home - made .

Here are some of my reasons for thinking that public transport is important .
Firstly , it is very good for the environment because it reduces a lot of carbon dioxide gasses which , if everybody took the car instead of taking public transport , would pollute the atmosphere .
Secondly , travelling in public transport makes it much easier to travel at rush hours or on those moments in which you should not take the car .
Finally , it is a good way of travelling because it is safer than travelling in a car or in a motorbike and also in the way that you are much more relaxed than in a car and it saves time , too .
To conclude , public transport is good for the environment , it makes it much easier and cheaper to travel , and it , in some way , saves lives .
For those reasons and some others , I think that public transport must be there for many years to come .

I 'm from Ecuador , a country surrounded by a great number of natural resources .
We are an underdeveloped country , like other countries says , a " third world country " , but I 'm happy about that .
Why ?
Seeing all of it , we will change our future , doing different things that they have done .
Recently , my country is starting to develop their resources , our renewable energy , such as wind , solar , hydropower , geothermal energy .
Nowadays , we really focus on how we can extract this energy , but not in other important things , like the way that we can start to use it , the correct use that we could give of them or how we can reuse the energy .
Traditional energies are focus on give to big cities all the resources .
Also , it is a big opportunity to help them .
It is difficult to understand a sectoral development where the global interest is in big cities , without looking after and help the surroundings .
Nowadays , my country have started to build a great number of hydroelectric , wind parks and we are also starting to think on geothermal energy .
All of that require further studies have been done and , with that , we could know the feasibility of the projects and the size of them .
Implementation takes time and money , but if the project does not work , all of that could be spent in vain .
It is like to make friendship with nature and knows that what it needs of us and show it what we need of it .

I live in one of the most polluted city in India and which is also the capital of India , i.e. Delhi .
However , the city has taken various steps and measures to keep it clean and green .
It makes it mandatory for the inter - city buses , commercial vehicles and other heavy vehicles to use Compressed Natural Gas ( CNG)instead of diesel .
Burning of leaves and other waste products have also been made a punishable offences .
A large number of huge capacity waste treatment plants have been established to keep the city clean and green .
Recently , for the protection of the environment , the Hon'ble National Green Tribunal passed an order banning diesel vehicles of more than 15 years old .
They are conserving rain water using a rain water harvesting process .
They are using more renewable sources of energy rather non - renewable sources of energy .

The Colosseum is the most famous and biggest building of the Ancient Rome and it is also the biggest amphitheater in the World .
The name of this construction is related to two reasons : one reason is related at the dimensions of the building , the second reason is because near there is a bronze statue .
In 1990 the Colosseum was put into the list of the heritage of humanity by UNESCO , while in 2007 it was included among the new Seven Wonders of the World .
The arena could hold about 70000 seats and the arena was about 75 x 46 meters and about 50 meters high .
It was built between 70 and 74 a .
C.
And it was inaugurated in 80 a .
C.
The Colosse was often restored because it was often in difficult situations .
Finally , I can say that the Colosseum it 's a fantastic construction as much for beauty as for importance , and if a tourist came in Italy for the first time he should see the Colosseum .

Very soon I had recognized that the process of learning was not as easy as I fought .
I had a lot of things to improve , such as writing and reading skills .

I hope we will pass it , because we did our best .

Whether movies and TV programs made in our own country are more interesting than movies and programs made in other countries has been widely discussed .
Many people are of the opinion that domestic movies and TV programs are better than foreign ones .
However , I strongly assert that movies and TV programs made in other countries are better for the following reasons .
To begin with , foreign movies and TV programs are more stimulating .
To elaborate , their story are better , as there are more twists and turns in the plots .
Although the plots are full of turns , they are still very reasonable , and do not make their audience felt that the plots are very strange .
For example , in the first one 3 dimensional movie , Avatar , the movie maker spend a lot of energy and time on developing the novel movie genre .
It eventually made a very good impression on its audience , and , the most important for a commercial movie , it really did very well at the box office .
Additionally , people can learn more things from foreign TV programs and movies .
Watching foreign TV programs and movies , their viewers can learn not only foreign language but also about exotic cultures .
Furthermore , foreign TV programs are more international and educational .
What 's more , the National Geographic and Discovery channels also teach me a lot of information and knowledge which I ca n't learn from native programs .
In contrast , some people consider that domestic films are more familiar than foreign ones .
However , I still consider that if people can learn some foreign culture , or appreciate the spirits which foreign films contain , they could get more reflection as recreating .
In sum , although there are some dissenting views , one can still safely come to the conclusion that foreign films and TV programs are more interesting than domestic movies and TV programs .
Although movies in our own country are more popular than in the past , the foreign movies still play important role on the domestic movie goer 's mind .

In this place , " Stella d'oro " , the owners prepare delicious rolls .
In particular , every week you can find " Il panino più " , a special roll created by the fancy of the cook .
Of course , I prefer to go to this pub with my family or with my friends , especially if I have to celebrate something , for example , birthdays , anniversaries or something else .
When I go there , I also drink a good mixed beer : half light beer and half red beer with of a good flavor .
Of course , with the roll we also order a lot of chips .
If we are all that we are still hungry , we order cakes .
Of course , if the six of us go together , it is quite expensive , but if I go only with my husband , I do n't spend so much .
I suggest everyone go to this place because , not only is the food good , but also , the owners are very friendly .
The only problem is to find parking space because this pub is in a narrow road where it is not easy to find a space to park the car .
But if you are lucky , you can park .

The doorbell rang .
When I opened the door , imagine my surprise .
There was a little cardboard box with my name on the top .
I was just about to close the door , when I heard mum from the kitchen : " Who was it , Bryan ? "
" What is it ? " she asked .
I had absolutely no idea .
I started to open it very carefully .
There was a ticket for my favourite music band .
They had a concert that evening in New York .
She was surprisingly open to the thought that I could try it at least .
So I did it .
The seats next to me were still empty .
In the middle of a crowd was standing my mum , with my dad , who had just returned from the war .
I were absolutely excited .
It was the best night of my life .
UNEXPECTED VISIT
The door bell rang .
When I opened the door , imagine my surprise ...
There was she , staying in front of me .
I thought I was dreaming at first .
She 'd stolen my fiancee many years ago .
We 'd been preparing to get married .
I'd been in my country for a while since I need to apply for a visa for living in his country .
Suddenly , he 'd cut the connection between us .
I could n't believe my eyes !
How come he 'd done that to me !
What happened to all those words he 'd given to me !
Asking him was useless .
I managed to keep calm though there was thunder inside my heart .
But I could n't speak anyway .
I just looked at her with asking eyes .
" He 's died . " she said , as if she was whispering .
Her voice was weak and shaky .
Then she handed me a box and walked away .
Nothing more ...
Now , after all those long years have gone by with full of pain , disappointments , missing and regrets ; all I have was the memories which were saved by him into a little wooden box .
I 've never got the reason that made him leave me , although all his love for me , unfortunately ...

I would like to say that learning any languages is complicated to someone , whatever you come from , but , in my opinion , there are many matter to discuss .
One child whose parents come from different countries is able to learn two languages at the same time , this child does n't need to go abroad to learn a foreign language , but they are listening to their parents speaking English , their native language , all the time and this let them learn without any difficulty .
On the other hand , if you go abroad you will be able to improve your English in an anglophone country , in this case , your knowledge will be reinforced with your stay there .
To sum up , if you want to learn English , you do n't need to go abroad , you can improve your English by working hard inside your own country , for example , by doing exercises like listening and writing , or you can meet with native people who speak English to practise with them .

As Lloyd Cohen ( the Director of the Worldwide Market Analysis ) said , lottery play is not economically irrational and uninformed .
It is certainly true that people who play are almost certain to lose money .
People do n't invest the money they spend on lottery tickets .
They spend it and get those dreams in return .
Though this has been an amusing debate , we the affirmative side , on the weight of our argument and proof , have concluded that the lottery should n't be banned in the US and Spain , because it is a tradition , it gives help , hope and support to public entities and it must be a rational investment .

Report :
The swimming pool in Brunete has customers from all age groups , but it is especially suitable both for young people and elderly people in order to improve their mobility .
The building has two changing rooms , for men and women .
As far as I am concerned , there are some pros and cons about the use of the swimming pool .
On the one hand , everything is very cleaned , including floor , bath and corridors , in addition , if you are a disabled person , you will not have any trouble to get in there because there are some ramps to help you come in .
On the other hand , you will have to pay 45 euros a month to use the facilities , and besides , you will not be able to do exercises because there is not any gym inside the building .
In my opinion , the swimming pool is convenient because you can walk to swim if you live in town , but it is very expensive , particularly for young people .

Public transport is the future .
Today in big cities , public transport is necessary for tourists , students , kids and workers ; but the situation is very different in small cities .
A good public transport system is the sign of a civilized city . in this way there are fewer cars , so less traffic .
Public transport also reduces the cars ' pollution and saves fuel .
I hope for the next generations for a better public transport service and an increasement of its use .

In contrast , in Taiwan , we have our own currency and the government is efficient and well - organized .
Clearly , Taiwan will not be the next Greece .

Obviously , Taiwan has its own currency , the new Taiwan dollar , and if Taiwan 's economy is worsening someday , the Taiwanese government could simply mimic what the Japanese government did in 2012 .
