Once upon a time , there was a mason called Nick that had a family of four , two sons and his wife , but they had conflicts with the studies of their children , and because the money he earned was not enough to maintain the whole family they were in poverty .
His kids dreamed with a big house that has a pool , a third floor , a Jacuzzi and a beautiful landscape to the beach , also they wanted to have a dog , if they had one , it would be called Winy .
They told every dream to their dad , and they know he would enforce it even though , under the circumstances , it seemed to be impossible , he would try .
Next week a cousin that he did not know , he was a very reach man and when he knew about their problem , he decided to help , so he gave them an incentive .
He said that if Nick makes a house of two floors , he would buy it and pay for the studies of the children lifelong , which gave a reverse to the impossible .
Nick started making the planes for the house , from that moment , he trended to get to his house and at the moment drag the planes and continue working . When he finished the planes after months of working on them , he started to bring it to life , the house would be made of wood because he could not pay for more .
After months of working in the house , he finished , and his cousin gave him a bonus reward of one million dollars to start with , buying a big house with everything they want .
The kids started going to a private school .
When they got eighteen , they could get a good job because of their good studies .

There are many famous buildings in Guangzhou .
One of them is Canton Tower .
If you travel to Guangzhou , you ca n't miss this series because this is a symbol of Guangzhou .
Canton Tower is located at an intersection of Guangzhou New city Central Axes and the Pearl River .
The height of the tower is 600 metres , with 450 metres of main body and 150 metres of its antenna .
We can see a different picture of the tower from different angles .
For example , the tower has a 4D cinema , the highest revolving restaurant , and so on .
Cantonese people always spend their holiday with their child here .
Do you want to go to have a look after reading my introduction ?
Trust me , you will not regret it .
ARE YOUR FAMILY MEMBERS YOUR BEST FRIENDS ?
Firstly , I must say that I do n't consider that my family members are my best friends , not only because they have other problems to care about , but also because I do n't know how to tell them my problems .
However , we consider a friend that person you can have fun with , laugh with and meet . I 'm use to do that with my parents and my brothers , but it 's not the same as when I meet my best friends .
Moreover , I think that I should n't ask them to have what we call a " therapy moment " as I do with my best friends when I 'm worried for something or someone , in fact , I would n't know how to start telling them about that .
In my town , there is no future for public transport , because the time necessary to get to the city centre is the same walking or going by bus .
This is like that on all days , except Sunday .
From this hour , there is only one service every hour , until 10 p.m. Anyone of these 7 bus takes less than a half hour to get to the city centre , in spite of the fact that Sunday has not traffic jam .
It is much more convenient if you walk to the city centre .
The town is not a big city , so the air is not very dirty .
At the same time , you can get fit by walking approximately 30 or 40 minutes , and you will not have the problem for park your car .
We have different means of transport .
They are transport by land , by air , by sea and by train .
We know in the olden days how our forefathers suffered in their movement .
Therefore , it is not easy back there for anybody to use other means because there was non .
At present , there are many means of transportation .
Unlike before , we have big ships to use on the sea .
The train is also a very useful means of transportation and very economical .
I believed that technology has really improve our ways and means of our transport .
So , whoever want to star a journey has several choice of transport , eaither by sea , by air , by land or by foot .
I can not forget to talk about cars , lorry and other vehicles .
They are very useful and speedy .

Status : Popular
' The moment of realisation hits you like a tons of bricks , leaving you in a life full of regret and guilt '
His whole life , he only wished for one thing , and that was to be popular .
Her name was Sara .
Michael had always seen her in the hallways , smiling and laughing .
Anywhere she went , she was always surrounded by a handful of students .
People got attracted towards her quite easily , and often , they would find themselves adoring and admiring her .
Although she was n't pretty , she had an aura of importance .
Her presence was felt .
She was popular but not proud , and that made her even more likable by all .
All but one - Michael .
Whenever , he saw her , he felt pain .
The pain of jealousy .
A fire of hatred burnt his heart whenever he heard her gleeful laughter .
All his life , he had only wished to be popular but his dream of popularity had been long ago snatched by a girl .
That girl , who had once been his best friend .
She was Sara .
His long lost best friend Sara .
That night had changed their lives .
Both of their lives .
In every way , in every form .
An innocent dare made by Sara , which led Michael to walk in a path of wrong .
A dare to prove .
courage can change lives .
He was isolated .
Abandoned by his friends .
All was a façade .
They had all worn masks .
Everyone , even his own Sara .
He had been wrong .
All along he was wrong .
They had n't abandoned him , neither had they distanced themselves from him .
He had distanced himself from them .
His Sara was there , all along she was there for him .
In the first place , she never left him .
Yet , she waited , hoping he would realise she would always be there for him .
Tears were streaming down his face . Stinging his eyes .
He deserved it .
Every bit of pain .
All these years .
His selfishness stood in the way .
His delusions had drifted him away from her .
No tears or sorrys would make a less culprit .
No one should forgive him for what he did .
No one .

In this essay , I am going to discuss whether building a bypass around our town is beneficial to our community or not .
One of the advantages pointed out by local politicians in the meeting was that this bypass would lower the rate of air pollution around town , which I highly agree with , because the extra traffic caused due to the passing cars added to the vehicles used by the locals cause massive smog in the atmosphere , not to mention being terribly bad to the health of the walking , cycling citizens , especially young children , babies .
Another important point is that this bypass would improve the traffic in the town center .
Mostly during 7 to 8 am and 3 to 4 pm , when people go to and finish work , that is when we get the most awful traffic jams , sometimes it takes an hour to get form point A to B in town , which is a terribly long time , not to mention parents who have to take their children to school , nursery and then get to work , too .
On the other hand , the bypass might cause a drastic drop in tourism in the town .
However , it is also true to say that people who are actually interested in historical sites would visit the town anyway .
All in all , I would say the bypass would be more of a disadvantage than an advantage , because it would cut us off from people and the town would receive less funding if it 's less important .
Local politicians should focus on sustainability , using vehicles which do not harm the environment .
On the 4th of April I met a group called Emblem3 .
Because I did n't find any ticket for the concert in London , I bought one for the concert in Birmingham .
The day before , I started to freak out thinking that I was meeting them .
Else the ticket for the concert , I bought the VIP ticket as well , so I had to go before to Birmingham , because the entrance to the venue was at 17:00 and , as I live close to London , I had to leave at about 12:00 so I did n't have to rush .
I got to Birmingham at 14:00 , I think , and then , as I 've never been to Birmingham , I had to look for the 02 Academy , where the event took place .
After 30 minutes , started the acoustic performance which lasted for about 15 minutes , afterwards we took pictures .
On the day after , I went back home .
It was the best day of my life .

It 's true that commuting to work is n't as convenient as going to work by car .
That 's the reason why more people prefer to spend more time stuck in traffic listening to songs instead of waiting a long time to take a bus which is usually crowded .
On top of that , taking a bus wo n't necessarily mean that you will save time , because both buses and cars wo n't be able to move in the rush hour .
Besides , a car gives you more freedom and flexibility to make your own schedule , while public transport limits you to a timetable that does not always meet your needs .
After cars prevailed among the public , our governments have tried to pave rough roads , which promotes people to use cars even more .
Nowadays , it might be argued if the current transportation system would be working in the future like it does in the present , while there is a still big room for public transportation remaining as a significant method .
However , it is also true that there are always minors who have no choice but to take public transport and also , for their parents , it is definitely more reliable .
What is also important is the impact on the environment , which is already considerably damaged by human technology .
If a car which emits no serious global - warming gas would be developed , there would be no argument that people had better reduce our use of cars , yet , as long as we are manufacturing them , we could not find more eco - friendly and efficient ways than public transportation .
In conclusion , it is my belief that it is not possible for public transport to disappear in the future , even though travelling with cars is more convenient than travelling with just trains or buses .

Why not ?

Personally , I think houses in the future will not be cosy , but very sterile . I do not like it .
Not with cold and spacious rooms .

Although driving by car is less safe than using public transport at present , driving will be safe .
However , there is also a problem .
The second problem may be solved by car - sharing .
By this method , people have to pay a small fee for use a car , not much money such as having a car .
People can go anywhere they want to go from anywhere .
People do n't have to possess their car , paying much money .
It will be a new kind of public transport .

Nowadays , everybody has one or more cars , as a consequence of that , some people believe that public transport is going to disappear .
There are several reasons to believe that ; firstly , many people are influenced by the advertising , which mixes happiness with driving cars and makes people think that public transport is not as a smart option as cars .
For example , you must take public transport instead of the car because it produces less pollution .
In addition , public transport is cheap because to buy a car meaning spend a fortune and in big cities , where people are concerned about the environment , such as Amsterdam or Tokio , there are many facilities as mobile phone applications or special offers .
To sum up , no one knows the future ; however , I believe that travelling on public transport is as convenient as by car or more so , because it is good to save up money and to reduce contamination .
" There is no future for public transport because travelling by car is so much more convenient "
In my opinion , less people are travelling by public transport and have started to buy their own cars , which is more comfortable to use whenever you are in a hurry or not .
In the first place , you feel more comfortable in your own car than in a bus , for example . You do n't need to fear that someone could suddenly stole your purse or you do n't have to listen to the others when you travel by your car .
Studies have shown that your self - esteem and feelings of protection increase when you are a car driver .
In the second place , not all public transports are in their best shape .
If you have your own car , these things do n't bother you anymore cause you wash your car anytime you want .
In conclusion , travelling by car is far better than using public transport .

A very different morning
The doorbell rang .
When I opened the door , imagine my surprise . There was a small present left on the ground .
I looked around but no one was there . "
Hmm ...
Is that present for me ?
" I asked myself quietly .
Besides , I was not sure whether I should take it up .
I looked around one more time but still I did n't see anyone .
As it was quite early in the morning , there was just silence everywhere .
I sat down in my kitchen and put the present on the table .
While the water was boiling , a lot of different thoughts came into my head : " I do n't have any birthday today and there are a few more months until Christmas ... What could be the reason for such a nice present wrapped in a pink paper ?
Maybe someone wishes to make some little surprise for me , does n't he ? " " Ok , lets open it !
" I encouraged myself .
Oh , if you only knew - that present made my day !
When I opened it I found there my favourite chocolate with a very cute ' Thank you ' letter .
I got it from my neighbour and he just was so thankful for my help tidying up his garden the week before .
Actually I love receiving presents .
They colour the world , they lift you up !
And there is a truth : the more you give , the more you get back !
Although many people believe that our lives are getting better than they where 20 years ago , scientist have proved that , if we carry on with our ways of living , using , for instance , modern technology , we will lose control of our lives .
Technology has reached such a point where we need to do anything in order to achieve something .
To support this idea , a study was conducted 6 months ago .
The study tried to explain people 's reaction to different resources .
Out of 20 tested people , 17 managed to write their composition within an hour .
Secondly , keeping the main task , they were given a tablet with wireless connection to use instead of books .
The objective of this study was to see how people adapted to new technologies and how our cultural roots are being forgotten .

WAYS TO TAKE CARE OF THE ENVIRONMENT
Introduction
The aim of this report is to inform you about the ways in which my village carries out measures to look after the environment .
For this , we will analyse several aspects , such as what local residents do with the rubbish and how Lanjarón tries to keep the area clean and makes it attractive to people .
Recycling : The best way to deal with the rubbish
Nowadays , there is more and more rubbish because of the high amount of package used to wrap products and the increase in consumption .
In Lanjarón , as in the rest of the villages and towns , people are getting used to buying and consuming much more than they used to do in the past .
For these reasons , what people usually do with their rubbish in their daily routine is to sort it and put it in the correct bin .
Keeping the village clean and attractive
Lanjarón is one of the most tourist villages in the region of La Alpujarra ; therefore , it is very important both for the council and the local residents to keep the village clean .
To get this , the council sets different environmental activities for the citizens to take part in .
At the end of the competition , those whose area is cleaner and most attractive receive an award .
Conclusion
We have to bear in mind how important the environment is to us .
On one , hand , some people think military service must be mandatory .
There are different dangers of a military nature , such as terrorist attacks , wars and other armed conflicts .
As a result , there are more chances to overcome the conflict with minimum human losses .
Moreover , it can educate young people to be more self - reliant , because the majority of teenagers at the age of 18 do not know how to be independent from their parents .
However , the critics claim that obligatory military service is a waste of time and has a negative impact .
For example , it is difficult to find a good job or go to university after military service , because during the one or two years of service , soldiers do not develop any knowledge except military knowledge .
Another big problem is that military service is dangerous and has a risk .
There are different physical exercises that can be harmful to health .
Besides , there are emergencies , which can happen with guns or weapons , such as explosions and accidents .
It means that soldiers who have already served some time , bully and beat up new recruits for fun .
These acts often turn out to be tragic , having a long post - traumatic effect on the young person or even loss of life .
Army years often have an impact on the whole family , especially in the case of bullying or the possibility of being sent to the warzone .
I prefer to eat at home
Also , the food I make by myself is much healthier .
But if I make my own food , of course , I wo n't use any kind of unhealthy ingredients .
And also , homemade food has a better quality than low - price restaurants .
Secondly , it 's much cheaper to eat at home , because restaurants want to earn money .
So you can save lots of money if you cook at home .
Some people think cooking for themselves is too annoying or tired , so they go out to eat .
But actually , if you cook much , you can use your energy , so you can consume your weight .
Also , if you cook three times a day , your cooking ability will go up .
Thirdly , eating at home is more comfortable .
When people are surrounded by strangers , people all think they are watching me so I ca n't do that or this .
But if you eat at home , you do n't need to be caring that somebody will look at you open your mouth too big or talk too loud .
Also , the restaurant do n't know how much you can eat , so sometimes , they give you too less food you do n't get full .
Or sometimes they give you too much food so you have to throw it away .
And as you know , throwing food away is a bad habit to do which makes our planet , Earth , will be polluted .
And sometimes , if there are many customers , you have to wait for the chef to cook other 's food first . You can save time if you eat at home .
Fifthly , we can have a family time while eating .
But if you eat at home with your family , you can have a joke while preparing dishes or talk about their own private life things .
Because it 's do not feel free to talk about anything outside , because the people at the next table might hear what you are talking about .
So , by having a family time while eating at home , you can have a talk and be a much closer family .
Because of these kinds of advantages and reasons , I prefer to eat at home .

This outcome , along with several studies , suggests reasonable use of connection media .
However , it is also likely that people 's life , such as loneliness and depression , might explain the effects that social media can have .
Furthermore , it is also possible that , in a future , people will be a subject responses , posts and chat rooms , in which there is awareness of wrong vocabulary , poor routines and compulsive use .
Some people claim that life will change a lot in the next five decades , but , how will it change ?
On the one hand , we have technology .
Technology has developed really fast in the last twenty years , so it 's expected to develop the same way in the next fifty years .
Cell phones are a great example of this evolution .
Fifteen years ago , cell phones did n't have music or a camera , while nowadays they have camera with high definition and you can download a lot of music .
On the other hand , we have transport .
Right now , people are starting to buy hydraulic cars which is more eco - friendly and cheaper because you do n't need to spend money in gas .
Basing on this , we can assume that this kind of cars will be the only ones on the streets fifty years from now .
Science will also change .
Every aspect of science will evolve , for example , new medical discoveries will be made by doctors .
Chemistry may have the chance in the next fifty years to confirm their theories about the existence of atoms .
To sum up , I believe that people 's lives will change a lot because everything will evolve .

My favourite kinds are comedis , detective stories and love stories .
I mostly like comedies because they create my mood and put me in high spirites .
Most of us think it 's a great idea , but is it better than our comfortable life in the city ?
Would we live better without technology ?
As we know , the countryside has no pollution compared to big towns , because there are n't cars , lorries , moped or any other motor vehicle .
On the other , hand , technology makes our life easier .
We can get information , chat with friends or even order food instantly with Internet , however unfortunately , we do n't have it in the countryside .
However , I think humans have evolved and we are very happy with technology and the Internet .
There is no doubt that using your private car is much more comfortable & convenient for any person .
Your car represents a kind of luxury & comfort , which is clearly illustrated during driving or travelling for long distances , as long as you have a comfortable seat with a certain personal zone area .
Moreover , you can control your driving speed as fast or slow according to your mood , and so , you own your time .
Even after your arrival , you will have your own car to go here & there fleetly & freely whenever you like , so you have a flexible schedule .
Besides , the presence of a car during a trip is very important for coping with the different conditions and environments you are facing during the journey .
On the other hand , public transport has now become non hygienic as lots of people are crowded into a small and closed area , and so , a lot of breathes & air droplets are easily propagated in this enclosed place and consequently , you are more susceptible to the various contagious diseases , especially in the winter season where the respiratory tract infections flourish , e.g. cold & flu .
And so you do n't own your time to do what you want whenever you like , although this is my leisure , my free time , which means the time of relaxation & meditation .
My town is one of the cleanest towns in my country , the authorities have been arranged amny procedures to ensure that the town keeps clean at the same time as be environmentally friendly procedures .
As a first step to keep the environment clean and healthy , is that the garbage needs to be separated into 3 parts that is why the environment department decided to give each house three recycle bins , one for food and green garbage , one for only papers and catroons and the last is for the rest .
Another handy rule has been decided which is the plastic and the glasses need to be thrown in different bins that are available for the public udsage in each supermarket center , in these , people can find these bins in easy destinations available everywhere .
All the previous steps and more are being applied by my town 's sitizens in order to improve the environment quality and go long with all the procedures that help them live a happily healthy life .
There should be a future for public transport .
It is more important than ever for anyone to think before using their own car .
We are damaging our planet .
We are using up our vital resource in a fast pace .
It is exactly the same for driving cars .
A lot of us , just turn on the engine of our cars without considering walking up to the bus stop .
The public transport system in the UK has so many problems to solve .
The punctuality of trains needs to be improved greatly , too .
In my opinion , we need to save a future for public transport for our future and it is vital to reduce the use of private cars . Travelling by car is more convenient , but with improved public transport , we need to reduce the use of cars .
All in one - come and watch
Have you ever been asked to make a decision and choose only one thing out of many that you really like ?
I am sure you have .
And then you always wonder what would have happened if you had chosen the alternative .
Maybe you just missed something really special ...
You do not particularly like that feeling , do you ?
There is a group of young people who decided once that it is ridiculous to choose if you can have all in one - do you want to meet them ?
Actually , you will have a chance soon .
The Red Dragon Theatre Group is coming to our town next week .
They will bring a lot of good sense of humour , music , dance , and anything you can think of that should appear on stage .
Their main concern is to make you think , laugh , maybe cry a bit , but above all , to give you a great time .
I bet you will love them at first sight .
The group is going to perform in The Globe theatre and they have promised to meet your expectations .
The choice is obvious this time ...
Simply , come and watch .
This amazing film is about two people from a crew of astronauts sent out in space to launch the ' HUBBLE ' telescope .
Soon , one of them was informed that an asteroid hit a satellite and created debris , which was heading for the Shuttle , where the two astronauts were .
Eventually , the debris hit the Shuttle and thus more debris was created which took the orbit of Earth and moved around it with a very high speed .
The damages which the impact of the debris caused to the Shuttle were catastrophic !
To survive , the astronauts had to get to the International Space Station , which was very far away from them .
Moving to the ISS , one of them lost his life and , so , only one of the crew remains alive fighting for the survival .
After the long sequence of events , the remaining astronaut first got to the ISS , then , with a Russian spacekraft , moved on to the Chinese space station called TIANGONG .
And so , the astronaut launched the escape pod and got home !
" Gravity " is indeed a great film and moreover , I myself recommend it to you , students .
My hometown , Piliyandala , is probably the smallest town in Colombo district and provides shelter for more than 100,000 people .
The town has approximately 15 villages and all of them are governed by the urban council .
The Garbage control service is one of the main supporting subsidiaries of the urban council , which was founded two years ago .
Five years ago , the town did n't have any garbage control services to manage the domestic rubbish .
With this garbage control system , household waste being collected on a weekly basis and transported to recycling centers .
Two years ago , the council started a wastebasket distributing program among the villages , with the intention of easing the garbage collection process .
With this approach , it is very convenient for the workers who are engaged in the garbage control service , because they can collect all the garbage of a village in one place .
Villages , on the other hand , are doing their best to reduce the load of domestic waste .

Also , thanks to the progress of medicine , we will achieve some important goals .
This will be a great achievement !

The stories of Stephanie and Ali in Rust and Bones , and Pat and Tiffany in the Silverlinings Playbook all began with their lives going through life - altering events .
In Rust and Bones , Stephanie injures herself in a brawl outside of a club and wakes up to realize she has had her legs amputated .
Ali , an unemployed father in his mid-20s who is struggling to make ends meet and support his young son , saves Stephanie and helps her get back on her feet .
Similarly , Pat and Tiffany were also going through hard times when they first met .
Pat had just gotten out of rehab for bipolar disorder , whereas Tiffany , a widow , who had just lost her job .
Once again , their relationship began as friends and transforms into love as they help each other conquer personal challenges .
In sum , both movies portrayed love as a chemistry reaction that stems out when two people are willing to help each other out of life challenges .
In the movie of Rust and Bone , Ali takes Stephanie going out and takes her swimming , even has sex with her , helping Stephanie to restore her life .
On the other hand , after Ali starts his kickboxing career , Stephanie always cares about his conditions , and then becomes his middleman .
Same as Rust and Bone , in the movie of Silver Linings Playbook , Pat companies with Tiffany to break away from the past ; and Tiffany help Pat to get the courage to find the way back into love .
All they want to do is to repair the love meanings and find happiness in their life .
Ali realizes he loves Stephanie and he wo n't be the man he used to be anymore , who do n't believe in love and only want one - night stand .
And in Silver Linings Playbook , Pat and Tiffany , who both used to be stuck in their misfortune in the pass , leave their pass behind and move on with each other 's love and support .
This two movies give us a concept : no matter how worse the lives are , love can make people brave and help them find out the value of their lives again .
Albeit those things in common , at the beginning of the movies , the depression of the characters came from different situation .
However , the characters in Rust and Bone are suffering from declined life quality ; Stephanie lost her legs , and Ali is an impecunious man .
In addition , love is portrayed in different ways in these two movies .
Silver Linings Playbook , as a Hollywood movie , describes the love story in a hilarious tone .
The scene is bright and the rhythm is light , even if in the saddest section .
Rust and Bone , on the other hand , presents the story in a realistic way .

They 're being followed constantly by paparazzi , and their private photos are being bought for millions of dollars .
Of course , being in a similar situation does n't seem to be easy but I think that it is one of the prices of being famous .
We should n't underestimate the importance of societal and environmental problems .
They both must be solved because of their great negative influence on the world .
On the one hand , I think that the most significant is societal problems because they cause other problems , including environmental one .
People always use nature and its resources to satisfy their needs .
Their activities caused lots of negative consequences , such as air , water and land pollution , deforestation and climate change .
These issues are so burning in developing countries .
That 's why I consider that societal issues are the most dangerous .
For example , developing countries can not protect the environment because of their poverty , low incomes , and population illiteracy .
Such disasters as earthquakes , floods and tornados affect a lot of people every year .
It has an unwilling impact on society as people are forced to save their lives , leave or renovate their houses , and to look for clothes , food and others .
In my opinion , the main decision is to develop people 's potential , and increase their awareness of personal effects on nature .
If people take responsibility for their actions , we will avoid plenty of consequences .
We must have strong leaders who will strive for a beautiful world .
People ca n't satisfy their limitless needs ; they think only about their wealth .
He must inspire others to achieve appropriate goals and to do their best for the world .
In my organization , we strive for peace in the world .
We believe that we can develop leadership in each person and in such ways we can avoid a lot of global problems .
This exchange program will give me the required knowledge that I can use effectively to develop Ukrainian society .
Sometimes I have an opportunity and desire to do something , whereas I do n't know how to do it properly .
I hope this international experience will teach me how to work on increasing my country 's welfare .
Though the new problems occur quickly in our state , some people and community , try to do their best to develop the civil and democratic society .
Moreover , our country pays little attention to them , so the population should do everything on their own .
What is more , this project will give me available experience , including specific skills that I can use to spread healthy tendency in the social sphere and careful attitudes to the environment .
It 's a multimedia device so that while you watch TV , you can listen and see other people or cartoons , and it seems the characters are alive talking directly to you .
Today the networks have a schedule of 24 hours of activities , you can watch the programs at any time you want to , and if you do n't like a program , you can change the channel and watch anything else , if the increase of channels and the competitiveness , the audience has increased also its power of choice .
We have the power to choose what we want , but with so many options , we must be aware of our own decisions , I want to say that , although we have so many options , not all of them are effective for us , we are able to decide if we 'd rather see a comedy or a documentary .
The programs tend to reproduce our real life and our desires , such as a soap opera which presents characters with difficult in their lives , but there are also the solution of all the problems at the end , the lady get married and live happily with his love forever .
Although they have a nice ending , we need to remember that the real life is different and the difficult makes part of our lives , they are there to us to give value to everything we have and to remember us how fragile and , at the same time , how powerful we are .
Having said that , we just need to remember to be aware of what we want to receive from TV while we are choosing a program to watch and be happy with our choices !
Pros and cons - cars in major city centres
In the last 10 years , every second family has had more than one car and , most of the times , each member of the family drives his own car .
Moreover , cars pollute the air significantly and it becomes unhealthy for breathing .
Only public transport is permitted on the main streets , because it is used from a lot of people .
Some drivers are not keen on this ban , because this is inconvenient for them .
In my opinion , these measures related to the ban of cars in the city centres are effective and limit the traffic jam and the air pollution .
How does Shakespeare make ' A Midsummer Night 's Dream ' magical ?
In ' A Midsummer Night 's Dream ' , Shakespeare creates a magical mood and setting by using characters , such as the fairies , and events ( such as transforming Bottom 's head into a donkey 's head ) .
He uses it to help her and try to solve the problems in the lovers ' relation ship as Lysander and Demetrius are in love with Hermia consequently Helena is in love with Demetrius .
It 's almost a love triangle !
The misuse of magic is when it causes an argument between the Athenians .
This whole dispute could have been avoided if not for Puck 's mistake .
Without the misuse of magic , the plot would n't be the same .
In this play , the fairies are almost like the heart of the book .
The fairies also affect nature as Oberon 's and Titania 's dispute results in the wind ' piping ' to them in ' vain'(2:1:88 ) .
Due to having fairies as characters , it adds magic , as fairies do n't exist in the human world .
It creates unreality and fantasy .
The fairies ' magic is built by the contrast of the lives of the fairies and those of the " mortals " .
As a reoccurring theme , Puck 's use of magic creates humour , conflict and balance in the play .
Puck 's magic also adds to his naughty , cheeky , attractive character in this play .
This also leads to more humour as Titania falls in love with Bottom and calls him her ' sweet love'(4:3:30 ) .
It also creates the comparison of Titania , a beautiful , delicate creature , whilst Bottom is completely grotesque .
The idea of Titania having a ' flowery bed'(4:1:1 ) and the idea of Bottom , at that time , looking ' monstrous ' and ' strange'(3:1:91 ) creates a distinction .
The image of the elegant fairy queen referring to a man with a donkey 's head as her ' lover'(3:2:186 ) seem ridiculous .
As well as for his need , he uses his magic to help ' A sweet Athenian lady ' ' in love'(2:2:260 ) ; namely , Helena , with her situation with Demetrius in Act 2 .
Therefore , he is shown as a sympathetic character .
However , Oberon also uses his magic to get the changeling boy from Titania .
When Oberon finds out that Puck has transformed Bottom 's head into a donkey 's head , he gets annoyed at first at Puck 's mistake but later realizes that Titania has fallen in love with a ' vile thing'(2:2:40 ) , a man with an ass ' head .
Titania 's uses her magic to ' bless'(5:1:383 ) the bride 's bed so that Theseus and Hippolyta would have beautiful children and live a happy , married life .
Titania 's fairies are also characters who use magic . They use it to protect their ' fairy queen'(2:2:12 ) from ' spotted snakes with double tongue ' , ' newts and blindworms'(2:2:9 - 11 ) .
Their magic , like Oberon 's , is used to help people , nevertheless not for themselves .
Also , the fairies ' language is magical , as most of their lines are spells and sound as if they were in a fairy tale .
The clothes of the fairies and their lives are also magical .
The place where Titania sleeps is full of ' oxlips ' and ' eglantine ' .
She sleeps on a bower and she wants a fan made of wings of butterflies .
The food they eat like ' apricocks'(3:1:152 ) and ' mulberries ' ( 3:1:153 ) sound exotic as well as not being our daily meals or snacks , which also shows another contrast between the humans and the fairies .
The language of the fairies creates magic by imagery that is absolutely exquisite .
Most of us probably haven't heard of ' oxlips ' ( 2:2:250 ) and ' woodbine'(2:2:251 ) .
Shakespeare 's choice of words creates this .
He talks about ' musk - roses'(2:1:252 ) and ' wild thyme'(2:2:249 ) giving us this image of this beautiful land , with green grass and all sorts of flowers .
This image will probably look like where the fairies live or associate it with a fairy tale .
By doing this , we begin to realize the magic in this play .
In ' A Midsummer Night 's Dream ' there are many spells , e.g.
Flower of this purple dye ,
Hit with Cupid 's archery ,
Sink in apple of his eye .
When his love he doth espy ,
Let her shine as gloriously
As the Venus of the sky .
When thou wak'st , if she be by ,
Beg of her remedy .
OBERON(3:2:102 - 109 )
The language used in this spell contains many references to nature ( ' Venus ' and ' Sky ' ) .
This is how it creates magic and creates the setting , as in William Shakespeare 's time , they did n't use many props .
Just by reading this , you can imagine this fairy king chanting a spell on a purple flower called ' love in idleness ' and you can understand Cupid ( the Greek god of love ) had blessed this flower with his archery , giving you an understanding that this is a love potion .
Shakespeare has also used metaphors and similes such as ' let her shine as gloriously as the Venus of the sky ' to create the thought that Helena should look like a ' goddess , nymph , ' in addition to being ' perfect ' and ' divine'(3:2:137 ) .
Shakespeare says ' Flower of this purple dye , Hit with Cupid 's archery ' , causing mystery and letting us think about what he means .
Shakespeare also uses the idea of magic in his conversations with other characters . For example : when Titania speaks to Oberon in 2:1:60 - 145 , she mentions nature many times .
She describes the winter as ' angry'(2:1:112 ) as Winter is sometimes thought of as a miserable season .
The fairies recite their sentences as if they were a poem or song . '
Spotted snakes ' and ' Thorny hedgehogs'(2:2:9 - 10 ) are references to animals .
Animals , insects and plants are commonly referred to in ' ' A Midsummers Night 's Dream ' and these descriptions add to the magic .
It creates the sense that the fairies thought that the animals were dangerous and the way they describe them engages the reader .
The description of the animals and insects makes them seem as if they were evil spirits to the fairies and spirits are magical .
This play also refers to ' sleep ' and dreams .
After all , the book is called ' A Midsummers Night 's Dream ' .
Due to the magic , the bizarre events were interpreted as a dream , as there 's be no easier way to make the humans understand the events that had just happened .
Thinking of it as a dream creates innocence and vulnerability .
Also , the thought of all four lovers having the same dream makes it seem strange and magical to them .
Also , Shakespeare uses the thought of plays .
He adds the play ' Pyramus and Thisbe ' which is a bit like a mini - play based on the storyline ' A Midsummers Night 's Dream ' , as there are two lovers whose parents do n't permit their marriage .
When the ' mechanicals ' , or workers , change into their characters , it is a bit like magic .
The characters in the play , like ' moonlight ' , are basic ideas of transformations like the ones that magic creates .
Also , there is the idea of the alteration of form that Bottom 's head gets ' translated'(3:1:104 ) into expresses the magical feeling that again this is not possible in the human world .
Potions are also used to show a sense of magic .
In the human world , they did n't use spells or potions .
The effect that ' love in idleness ' has in the play , creates the plot and so potions play a main role in the book .
Without magic , the play would not have the same elements of humour .
Also , the absence of magic would alter the overall plot .
The repetitive theme of magic plays a significant role in the play .
To summarize my points , I personally think that Shakespeare presented magic in the play by using thoughts such as transformations , spells , potions and aspects that do n't exist in the human world .
Shakespeare has done it again !

Enterprises want to recruit young and experienced people and universities and schools have noticed that , so they are hands on the task .
I shall consider two of the proposed methods .
Students will be able to get know deeply their task as employers .
So , including in the CV the experience , seems to me , a step further in the students ' s career .
I entirely share this idea .
Universities are supposed to give their students information about the skills that a work involves .But sometimes , universities gives them more theoretical formations instead of the practical formation which enterprises are searching .
Generally speaking , students finish their degrees with a limited range of experience .
I would therefore argue that the best way to help students is to combine a kind of " training " for their work life and some theoretical knowledge .
They have to learn the skills that a job involve and the only way to get this is by practicing .
Now a day 's , we are having " n " number of International Sports , where one can prove their own talent and have their socialism .
The shape of the court is in a rectangle and it is divided in half by a net .
It 's a good exercise to make one fit and it 's easy to play .
The fun in this game is that we need to drop the shuttlecock on the other side of the court and wait 's until the opponent responses to it .
As it 's a mind - set game , the player need to focus on the weaknesses and act accordingly .
To be a successful player , one has to learn some tricks , which helps make their game easier .
And last but not least , as a player , one has to keep in mind that , they should not get depressed when they feel that their game is going out of their hands , where instead of that , one has to fight until the last mint of the game in order to decide whether the player is the winner or the loser .
Thus , by boosting themselves lead to success .

La Cacharrería is a small , Spanish restaurant in the old town of Cáceres .
It is a popular place .
The interior is simple .
The tables are small and tall but they are comfortable .
The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed .
There is a little courtyard with three tables .
La Cacharreriaes is a tapas restaurant , so you can choose lots of different , small dishes and share them .
I also recommend the zucchini flower or the salads .
The food is always fresh .
The service at La Cacharreria is very good .
Another thing about this restaurant is that it is cheap , about 20E per person .
I recommend La Cacharería , because it is a great place for a quiet meal with friends .

Sleeping to much is a relief , but for others it can be torture .
Different factors such as stress , psychological problems , noise , lights , that do not let you rest .
" Sleep and Your Health " talks about this .
They mention 3 things we should do to sleep better and be healthy as well , which we will discuss below .

There are different medications or even natural things to improve these conditions .
In summary , it is important to pay attention to our health .

The statement - ' There is no future for public transport , because travelling by car is so much more convenient . ' can be discussed in relation to two different aspects .
Transport has become faster and more convenient , and it can be attributed to a lot of factors , such as better roads , new technologies and innovations etc .
People who travel daily to work , usually prefer public transport over their own car as it is a cheaper option .
Also , as public transport such as the metro do not need to face traffic , it is always a faster way to reach the office .
On the other hand , if I would be travelling to see my friends or family in a nearby town or just on a holiday tour , I would prefer my car .
In future ; the environment will also become a key factor in determining the state of these transport mediums .
In my opinion , it is , probably , the base of the values of every society , because our children from now will be the men or women of the future .

Public transport was developed for people who were poor and could not afford their own transport .
At first , this transport was appreciated marvelously .
Everyone felt so delighted , but unfortunately , now people feels uncomfortable when it comes to travel via public transport .
In the early days of public transport , people were only stick to their normal routine and did not wish to earn more from their job or work .
Today , every single person is curious to earn money as much as they can and the interesting part is that this curiosity is increasing day by day , and so is their income .
So , now , almost 80 percent of people can afford their own transport .
The main advantage of having your own transport is that you do not have to wait for the public transport , you can save your time as you only need to accelerate your own transport and drive to your destination .
Public Transport is slow now , even though they are very comfortable , but unfortunately , people feel public transport is for poor people and if any middle class or upper class would travel through public transport , it would affect his respect .
But still there are so many people who use public transport frequently , but that is only their compulsion and poverty .
When they would be financially stable , they would surely buy their own vehicle .
It is a well - known fact that transport is quite related with pollution .
Wheter public transport might be the solution , or be more adeccuate or not , it is something with arguments in its favour and against it .
You do not have to wait for a specific time to cath the bus , for example .
Secondly , people think buying a car is a cheaper option in the long term than travelling by public transport every day .
We also speak about noise .
If everyone travelled by bus , cities would be a quite different to the ones we know now .

The Home of the Future
Having lived during the century , which provided humanity with glass houses , question ponders , how will the home of the Future look like ?
Predictable , some of the solutions will remain intact .
Any changes would mean a resignation of comfort .
Buildings will become smaller , yet more functional and organised .
As a matter of fact , reduction of living space will not be noticeable due to thinner walls .
The windows are bound to be broader .
The screen will be no longer required for the computers and TV .
All electronic devices will be controlled by the voice or thoughts .

My name is Arturo Archuleta , I 'm from Mexico and I 'd like to talk about my favorite sport , " Muay Thai " .
The first time practicing Muay Thai was 5 years ago , at that time , I was n't sure of practicing it because I did n't consider myself strong enough for fighting , that 's what most of the young people think , at least in Mexico and some other countries , and that 's one reason why people do n't practise Muay Thai and it is not well known .
It was hard at the beginning , just like when you start doing something new , so here are some tips if you want to start practicing Muay Thai .
Be confident
Work on it , that 's part of mental strength .
Warm - up
Before starting the practice you should warm up , you do n't want to cramp up , right ?
Never give up
If you do n't know how to kick or blow , ask your shifu ( teacher ) and keep doing it until you get it .
Practice
All this will help you to improve .
Enjoy
You know you like a sport when you enjoy it and you feel comfortable to practise , that 's what I recommend you do , enjoy and be happy practicing because Muay Thai is a beautiful sport !

I 'll try to explain .

THE LUCKIEST MAN IN CÁCERES
The luckiest man that you can know in Cáceres is called Sergio .
He is still in his twenties and he has studied computer engineering .
Until now , all is normal in his life .
However , when Sergio finished his studies he was hired by Microsoft in the United States .
Despite this , one day Sergio realised that what he was doing was not his true dream .
He did not want to earn much money , what he truly wanted was to earn enough money to travel around the world , and not a job which does not allow him to do his hobbies , although it gives him a lot of money .
Then Sergio left Mycrosoft , created his own website which gave him enough money , and travelled wherever he want .
Now he is a famous person on the internet because of his blog : ' Live to the fullest ' .

The population grows , with more business skyscrapers , residential houses and advanced transportations , at the cost of diminishing farmland and , wetland as well as deforestation .
Though the modern cities are emerging repaidly , the problems caused by excessively exploiting the enviorment are severly various .
It is clear that habitats for all kinds of wildlife are vanishing as the bio - diversity decreases .
The red coral reef off the coast in Austrialia , for instance , serve as a shelter for algea and other sea tiny fishes and an index of enviroment fragility .
Due to the massive construction of five - star hotels on beaches , the biological chain there are cut off and enviromental variations are gone away .
On top of that , It is the regulation capacities of the enviorment that for temperature , moisture and even the sandstorms are erode as less plants engage inhale carbon dioxide and exhale oxygen into the whole system .
Secondly , the government must fund environmental organizations , in order to manipulate and coordinate more power to stop the illegal hunting , deforesting and animal extinctions .
Furthermore , the government should go out of their ways stand united in such a way which joint endeavours could be effective globally .

In the moment of choosing , very different aspects , like ecological effects , the economic viability and even time uses , take part on the decision .
Firstly , the car option is the best one in terms of comfort , because you do not depend on a specific time to travel and modern cars have the best technology in equipment and facilities .
By the other hand , traffic is the biggest trouble talking about transport , the cars facilities are replaced by the need of punctuality and , depending on the city , the delays are a concerning point when we talk about travelling by bus or trains .
To sum - up , neither cars nor public transport is considered the perfect option , but considering the long term consequences , as is nowadays common in some European countries , bicycles are the best way .

Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her .
She went to the kitchen and saw a beautifully prepared breakfast .
Suddenly , she remembered that for three days she had been living with Chuck - her boyfriend .
The day was very sunny and cloudless .
Flowers was in every colour of the rainbow , the leaves on the trees were going green .
When she came to the office , she saw on her desk a note with a heart shape .
She smiled and thought that it is a joke .
But moment later , she found a second letter about the same shape .
She opened again and again read : " Meet me at 11 at the fountain in the park " .
Anna looked at her watch and went as fast as she can run to the park .
It appers that at the fountain stay Chuck , and waiting for her .
When she come closer , he knelt on one knee and said : " Will you marry me Anne ? " .
She was shocked .
She was run out of words and just nod her head , what it means : " yes " .
They together come back home and spend the rest of the day together .
At the end of the day , she said : " You 're right .
It 's the best day of my life " .
Sarah focused on her cellphone , and Stephan was listening to music loudly with his MP3 .
After a few minutes , Sarah was chatting happily on the cellphone and did n't see there was a tree in front of her , so she bumped into the tree and hurt her head .
Sarah yelled loudly for help , but Stephan did n't notice and hear that , so he kept on walking and listening to his music .
Fortunately , there was a mother with her child strolling behind them , and she saw Sarah got hurt .
They took her to the hospital .
Stephan was still listening to the music and crossing the street .
But he did n't aware that the traffic light has turned red , so the car could n't go through .
The man in the car was very annoyed and pushed the horn seriously , but Stephan did n't hear that .
The man got down the car to tell Stephan to stop listening to the music and pay attention with things around him .
Stephan went to the hospital immediately to see how Sarah was .
Luckily , Sarah was fine due to the woman who was walking behind them had called the ambulance at once .
Stephan was glad that Sarah was alright and also thankful to the woman .
After these incidents , not only Sarah but also Stephan realized how dangerous it was when you focused on technological products instead of the things around you .
Book Review :
The Hunger Games
I have just read the first book in a trilogy called The Hunger Games .
When I started reading I could not put it down because it is a fascinating story that grabs you .
The story takes place in a country called Panem which is located in what was once known as North America .
Katniss , the protagonist , is a teenage girl of 16 which is forced to poach to feed his family since his father died
An increasing number of people begin to discuss for the success in school or work , and whether the having an ability to adapt or adjust to conditions or circumstances is more important than having excellent knowledge or a field of study .
Many people air their opinions based on their own value system .
However , does the claim really ring true , conforming the real situation ?
It is my contention that the people , who have the ability to adapt or adjust to conditions or circumstances have a higher percentage be successful in school or work .
That is why it is not to be the key point that is considered the key to success .
According to the investigation conducted by the 104 human resource bank , the percentage of people using the knowledge in the work field that they learnt from school has surprising reduced in the last two decades by roughly thirty percent , a figure that has nearly one half compared to that of a half - century ago .
This phenomenon had been curiously many experts .
In sum , there may be some people who may disagree with my position on this matter .
In this essay , I will discuss whether older or younger parents are better .
Nowadays , the statistics show that many people are younger than in generations before .
Every child wishes to have young parents , but is it really better ?
Actually , the teenagers are right because younger parents have a stronger relationship with their children .
Apart from this , the small difference between the ages is also an advantage .
On the other hand , a disadvantage is that young parents are not able to protect their babies without having experience on that .
In my age , young parents and I have in common that we go out in the evenings .
From my point of view , older parents can give better advice in every difficult situation .
However , the progress in adolescence is important for the next stage of life , so I believe both are good at bring up their children .
To conclude , you can not change your parents anyway .

There are some solutions to prevent the rise in the consumption of sugar - sweetened drinks .
The first solution is to change the portion size of soft drinks , which means smaller size of beverages could contain less sugar .
The National Nutrition Survey(1995 ) points out that the most consumption of beverages for a teenager per day is sugar - sweetened soft drinks .
Therefore , the changing portion size of soft drinks would be efficient to reduce sugar intake for teenagers each time .
The limitation of this solution is the public may not be satisfied with this size of soft drinks .
To overcome it , the producer of soft drinks could take a investment to teenagers what size is suitable before changing it .
Another solution to this problem would be education .
Family education would be introduced to their kids .
The National Nutrition Survey(1995 ) reports that teenagers are the main soft drinks consumers and the most consumption of beverage is sugar - sweetened drinks .
If parents educate their children to keep away from soft drinks or cultivate the awareness of drinking water .
They would not consume such a large amount of beverages .
However , children my get soft drinks outside the family .
Therefore , their kids would follow their parents ' habits and behaviors .
In conclusion , increasing the consumption of soft drinks is one of the issues to prevent from obesity and overweight .
A number of strategies could be efficient to address these problems .
Teenagers are the main target who drink too many soft drinks .
So that parents ' education and changing portion size could be useful to address the problems which happens around teenagers .
We can say that the Coyle 's idea is well developed thanks to two features that pass through the chapter and likely the entire book : first of all , many significant references and specialized people are mentioned to define what " deep practice " is ( a psychologist , some experts in their own field , authors who have already analyzed that particular topic … ) ; secondly , but no less important , Coyle himself collected the most of his information while visiting at least nine places , nine " hotbeds " ( 12 ) where talents grow , as a sort of collection of data gathered from laboratory experiments .

In my country , I have two sincere friends since we were about 7 years old and we still in a strong friendship up till now .

Meanwhile , we support each other in crises , regular life troubles and sickness .
Skate or Hate
As I am in my late 20s , I 've found it hard to find a sports activity that would neither be so competitive as those in fashion in my country nor as demanding , so I could do it in my free time .
One fine summer 's day , I was walking along the streets of a coastal city when all of a sudden I came across a shop that caught my eye .
In one of the windows I found a skateboard and along came the memories of the year 2000 and the MTV channel that I was brought up into .
I thought to myself that could be a challenge and , with no second thoughts , I purchased the board .
It is funny how such a simple activity can bring so much joy into a person 's mind during the well - deserved breaks .
I suggest playing safe and being patient .
No future for public transport ?
However , the latest studies shows a car is not always more efficient .
In deciding whether to choose a car or public transport we need to consider many factors , such as length of journey , time of the day we travel , area we travel through , number of us , weather etc .
As there are cases where a car is much more efficient than public transport , and the other way round .
In addition , travelling by train saves a great deal of money as there is no parking fee .
Moreover , there are discounts for regular journeys .
A car is unbeatable for its flexibility .
Although , there are some disadvantages of using a car , such as traffic jams and a high maintenance cost .
All in all , in most cases , using your own car can save you money , time and effort .
The popularity of cars confirms it .
Therefore , it has a safe place in our society .
The use of public transport has become an important issue nowadays .
There are those who try to avoid the use of public transport and prefer driving their own car due to the advantages it offers .
However , there are those who reject this and are in favour of the use of public transport .
Firstly , it allows you to go directly somewhere , without finding out the information about the timetables of public transport such as buses or trains .
Another benefit of not using public transport is the time you can save .
For instance , if you have to go to another city by bus or train to reach your workplace , the time you waste since you set off increases .
Saving time in the mornings allows you to sleep more or to spend more time with your family .
Moreover , the use of your own car has more advantages . Travelling by car avoids you getting wet when the weather is rainy .
The government usually advise the population to use public transport to cut down pollution and the amount of gases which damage the atmosphere .
In addition , it is often claimed that it is cheaper than travelling by car .
Although it has some benefits , in most part of the country , especially in the smallest towns , the public transport is not enough developed .
In my opinion , it could be useful hardly ever times , so it would be necessary a great amount of improvements .
This is an interesting concept because it can give the government the money it needs to solve its other problems and does n't necessarily break any rule of personal space .

Finally , to say that it is a perfect sports centre and inexpensive , including a range of activities .

The bomb was going to blow up in a few minutes .
All in all , he would n't be able to stop the device .
Only a few long seconds spent thinking about what he had to do : he had to save the passengers .
He was scared .
He wanted to cry .
Desperately he started to kick the door , furiously , blind with rage , harder , faster .
The door opened .
Fortunately , a voice from the radio was trying to contact the man .
In a hurry , he dashed to the microphone and answered the control station .
" Where are the brakes ? "
Now in the distance he could see the first skylines of the city .

Recently works Google , a multi - million dollar company , who is not only famous for search engines , is working on self - driving cars .
It is surely a fact that autopilots in car 's sure are handy .
Although it must be admitted that driverless vehicles are expected to help children , the blind , the elderly and others who currently can not safely drive themselves .
On the other hand , it will lead to more driving , because smarter driving reduces the cost per mile of vehicle usage .
The end result of additional driving could be more traffic and more aggregate fuel consumption .
To put the whole matter in a nutshell , the self - driving system is good to prevent accidents .
However , you should still be able to drive by yourself you can not only rely on that system , it is still not free from errors .

It was an immense amphitheater .
Thousands of people fought as gladiators .
It is in the shape of an oval but most of it is broken .
The italian name , Colosseo , is quite close to english .
Visitors can enter it and admire the inside .
It is the most popular amphitheater in the whole world .

Hi !

Now let me give you some advice about how to get to my place in Madrid .
When you get to Barajas airport you 'll have to take the subway and go to Atocha station and there you 'll have to change line and catch line three to get to Sol station .
I 'll be there to meet you .
If you 're not up for it , you can just get a taxi at Barajas airport to the same direction .
I strongly recommend the first option because it 's cheaper than the second one .
Besides , this way you can have an exciting start in Madrid .
If you get lost in the metro , do n't worry .
Give me a ring and I 'll pick you up wherever you are .

Juan
Saving the environment
AS we know , our planet 's condition is getting worse every day .
This is because human activity releases into the air substances that damage several things in our planet , such as the atmosphere and ecosystems .
The global warming , deforestation and drought are some of the consequences , therefore , we can do countless things that appear to be meaningless , but if everyone does it we can live in a much healthier planet .
Every day , scientists try to develop new ways to improve the way we live , so that we are hable to pollute less the planet .
It sounds a little bit strange , but by installing solar paniels and other features in these homes , we live a much greener life , undoubtedly , there would be some changes but , because we know why we are doing it , there would be no problems .
Also , the effects of those actions would be gigantic and would help improve the environment situation . Nevertheless , we will still have to change some activities and be less self - centred , so that we can all work for a greater objective .
In my opinion , in a decade we will be living in these homes , I ca n't wait to live it .

In order to be fit , you can run or ride a bike for two or three weeks and , after that , you are going to be prepared to play football .
The equipment is very important too .
I recommend you to play it with your friends , but if you are in a new city , you can search for teams on the Internet .
There are a lot of opportunities .
To improve your skills , you can practise alone and you will became better than before .
So play football and enjoy it .

The Vietnamese education and study system is completely different from the Australian one .
Like to Asia countries , such as : Korea , China , and Singapore , the Vietnamese education and study system is really harsh and highly competitive to all students , especially for the primary students .
They have to study a lot , with from 5 - 6 subjects in a semester .
These subjects mainly focus on math skills , grammar , writing , but there are not any courses related to life and communication skills or innovative science .
All subjects are less flexible and all students are learning the same programs at the same time .
Meanwhile , the Australian education and study system is easier and more enjoyable than the Vietnamese system .
In a class , there are very few students with many more flexible study programs .
Additionally , the subjects in the school are given with the aim to develop the thinking and creativity of students .
They also play many interesting sports .
Secondly , it is not only from the school but also Vietnamese parents of the primary students who are also expected in the education of their children .
They usually hope that their children will get on the highest scores in school .
Consequently , Vietnamese children have not any life skills and have many health problems , such as : short - sighted , tummy - ache , spinal column … Sadly , the proportion of Vietnamese children who are short - sighted tend to increase in recent years .
Meanwhile , Australian parents also care about their children but in other way with Vietnamese parents .
To sum up , Australian children are happier than Vietnamese children . I think that primary students need to spend more time for playing and enjoy their childhood .

Throughout my life , I have lived in a few cities and villages located in the South of Russia .
Each of the cities has a unique set of transportation means .
In villages , the only way of public transportation is small buses , most of which can service up to twenty passengers in any moment of time .
In regional centers , most people commute via trolleybuses and tramcars .
The latest is the transport of choice of most people because its passengers very rarely lose time in traffic jams due to dedicated railway passages .
Those who are not satisfied with the public transportation system may use private vehicles .
I estimate more then 99 percent of them are cars .
I used to travel on buses .
But recently I bought a cheap bike and really enjoyed riding in the summer time .
Now , in November , the weather in Russia is not so good , so I switched back to buses .
My most recent dream is to ride on the EuroVelo roads network .

Some insist that no one will need a bus or the subway in the future .
However , in my opinion , it will rather useful to use public vehicles as time goes by based on two critical reasons .
First , people do n't want to waste their time finding parking lots .
The more people have their own cars , the more space to park is needed .
Unfortunately , there is a certain limit to space , so it is not possible that everyone can use their car every day , especially in mega cities like Seoul , New York , and London .
It is more convenient to move from here to there when you take the bus or subway , because you do n't have to worry about your car while working .
The second reason is more important and obvious .
It is related to the environmental issues .
Using public transport means help to protect the Earth from air pollution .
Surely , the government will try to make a better system of public transport because they want citizens not to use their own means .
For these reasons , there will be the future for the public transport , always .

This type of transport is a great contribution to the environment , because it 's cleaner than those that need petrol or diesel to work .

So , the convenience of travelling by car is not totally true .

Dearest Renee ,
How 's your first English literature lesson at school ? I hope it had loads of fun with plenty of new knowledge acquired !
I had learnt about the special features of the 16th century acting business and theatres in London , as well as the lifetime of William Shakespeare .
I ca n't wait to tell you more !
During the reign of Queen Elizabeth I and King James I , play watching was an entertainment for the locals to relax .
As it cost very little to get into an open - aired theatre , everyone jammed in and jostled to watch plays , though the poor stood under bright sunshine and had their heads burnt , while the rich sat in the shelter with an extra shilling paid .
At the same time , actors were busy dressing and reciting the scripts . '
Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs . '
Do you remember this famous quote from Romeo and Juliet ?
Frankly speaking , actresses did NOT exist !
They used props , thick make - up , gowns , wigs and all sorts of accessories .
The ' Juliets ' even had to shave their beard and moustache and enjoy their role throughout the play .
One more interesting fact is that , both the lovers in the play were Italians , but their playwright had never been to Italy .
It could reflect the fact that 16th century London was a melting point of different cultures and Shakespeare probably got in touch with Italian culture by making friends with those local visitors .
Three trumpet blasts were given symbolizing the start of a play , yet none of the respected silence would be given .
The audience would boo and throw fruits to the actors in case they did n't like them .
Cannonballs were rolled around to make the sound of thunder .
Stage trapdoors allowed actors to vanish magically .
In a roofed - in theatre , pulleys and machinery were used for lowering actors on the stage .
By now , I have widened my horizons and increased my interest towards the spotlight on playhouses .
Write soon !
Cheers ,
Michelle
My village has been working on this project for decades . They have been fixing their techniques and they still know a day 's everything has cost us a lot of effort , we started from the easiest examples ( dividing rubbish into different containers ) to some that are more complex ( renewable energy ) .
The principal things everyone must have at their houses are three trash can for the division of the trash ; one must be for renewable materials ( rest of food , paper , carton … ) another for plastics , and the last one for glass .
All the energy being used in the town is renewable energy ; ( hydraulic energy , solar energy and wind energy ) . Every house has a solar panel that gets the sun light transforming it into energy , that provide part of the energy to each house on the days that the sun shines , but if there is no sun , the village has a dam beside us which provides them enough with water for the whole village and also with hydraulic energy ; not only do we have hydraulic energy , but also wind energy ; in the out skirts of the village , there is a wind power plant where the wind energy is produced .
Also , our water has one of the best purification methods . After we use it , we clean it so we do n't contaminate the water of the river or dam .
To try to keep the environment clean , we have a big group of voluntary workers that work after their jobs here trying to keep this area as clean as possible by picking up all the rubbish and controlling the whole area in case there is something not normal .
Apart from this group of voluntaries every person of the village is obliged to take care of the environment and use the car as little as possible so the pollution is as minimum as possible . Here the bicycle is the most famous way of transport car are n't common . They are only used when transporting heavy thing or when travelling long distances .
But does everyone think in that way ?

In conclusion , buying new things is a good idea to spend an fascinating time with friends , however we could also lose a lot of money .
This bar chart deals with the costs of three different photocopiers .
Therefore , it compares the purchase price , the warranty expenses and the running costs of each product .
Interestingly , the pruchase price of " Carde " and " KD " is almost the same .
In " Cardas " case , the amount is $ 600 and " KDs " price is vagualy $ 700 .
However , " Sebu " rocks with a pruchase price of $ 1,000 .
All the photocopiers show a very low warranty price .
In this category , " KD " exeeds with a cost of $ 200 .
Wherby " Carda " and " Sebu " score with warrnty expenses of under $ 150 .
" Cada"s product has the highest running costs , with $ 1,200 .
In the case of " KD " , the running charges come only up to $ 800 , and " Sebu " has obviously the lowest expenses , with $ 600 .
As a long term investion , I would choose the " Sebus " model even though its purchase price is very high .
The reason therefore are its small warranty cost and especially its low running costs .
The kenn running expenses will compensate for the purchase price in the future .

This project is a Historic Research on the relation between the Euro and Denmark , to discover and understand the changes made by Denmark 's Institutions and Government as to adequate their social , economic and political system in relation with the new European currency .
With this research I want to discover if those changes helped Denmark protect itself from the European crisis .
This study project will be developed by studying :
-old and contemporary Danish journalistic articles ;
-Danish and European Institutions such as the ECB , the European Commission , the Danish Ministry of Economy and Foreign Affairs , and it will be necessary to make and analyse interviews to Danish and European politicians , economists and experts of this historic and economic field .
The aim is to trace the new political , economic and social structure of Denmark in relation to the Euro and all its consequences .
To ensure safety , wearing safety shoes is the most basic measure .

This humble and famous man is called Kinta Kenneth .
He fought for the liberation of slavery in West Africa .
He put the Gambia on the world map .
Kinta Kenneth was a captured slave from Naima Juffera .
He was captured while hunting with his colleagues in the forest .
This was in 1879 during the slave trade period .
Kunta was captured because he was trying to rescue his friend who was lost in the forest .
He ran away from them but they later captured him with their dogs .
Kunta was sold to a slave master in South America .
While in capture , he fought for the rights of all the black slaves in the campus .
He refused to work more than eight hours a day and he refused to take orders from the slave master .
He did very well during their exam and was given another opportunity to teach English to other slaves .
But was later betrayed by his slave masters .
He organised demonstrations which turned out to abolishment of slavery .
He died during the demonstration .
The history of Kunta Kinta is part of our national history .
Kunta was not only a great man in the Gambia , but a hero .
