My favourite sport is a Tamil sport known as Kabadi .
At the outset , let me tell you about this sport and how it is played .
There will be 2 teams and each team consists of 6 players and the players assume the border line as their own border .
This makes the game war - like and very special to Tamils .
The rules of engagement are quite simple .
Each team gets an opportunity to raid the other 's field alternatively , and the first one to raid is decided by the toss of a coin , as is usual as in most games .
The rules are pretty simple , but the game is quite tough , you'll hurt yourself really bad .
It takes a day to count the scratches on your body after the game .
But that is the reason Tamils enjoy the game and they cherish it .
It says the bravery of men is reckoned by the number of scars on his body , except on his back , because they thought to be dead in the field is far better than retreating .
There are accounts to say about a woman who cut her breast because she found her son 's body pierced by a long narrow spear - like weapon in his back rather than in the chest .
So , I like this game because it reflects the Tamil culture 's important value , which is giving high rank to bravery .
I love to play the game with my friends in my village , a very refreshing game , I would say .
it can be very strange , but i was very exited , because ,
on this date , the BBC released the new series of Doctor who ...
It is a popular English science fiction series and it tales about the adventures of the " Doctor " .
the Doctor is an alien from the planet Gallifrey and he travels in all of time and space with his companions , that are normally humans . in his experiences he saved whole planets to other bad aliens .
Doctor 's travelsmachine is a Policebox ... it is small and blue outside , but it is bigger on the inside .
I like Doctor Who very much . I have always dream to travel everywhere in time and space since I was a little child ! ! !
! if,(one day)I will have the possibilty to do it , I will go to distant galaxies and I will see how the universe began .
in my opinion , this serie was wonderful and , i hope for the next one !

My favourite sport is not a sport as you may think of it .
Most people who do sport want to be fit and stay healthy .
Sport is connected with moving a lot in any case .
My favourite sport is different .
Skat is an old German card game .
You play it with 32 cards and you need 3 or 4 people who are able to play it .
I enjoy playing it so much because it 's really challenging .
Every game is different .
Secondly , the people you play with are very different too .
If you are very good , you can take part in competitions .
There are German championships every year and there is a league , too , where teams of 4 play against each other .
I hope you can imagine how much I like my hobby .
I really ca n't understand why chess is considered to be a sport and Skat is n't .
It helps me to stay fit and makes me forget all the worries and stress of my work days .

While William Shakespeare wrote his plays and made the Thespian art to flourish in England , in Russia it was the very dim and sinister period of Ivan IV the Terrible 's reign .
So , in Russian print , the name of Shakespeare is mentioned first in 1748 .
First translations appear in the end of the 18th century , but this is not Shakespeare actually , because they are made from German or French and the translators change plots as they want ( and turn them into some tearjerkers as a rule ) .
For example , in one of the " Hamlet " translations , the main subject of the play turns out to be the relationship between Hamlet and Ophelia and Ophelia , in a meantime , appears to be a daughter of Claudius ( obviously to make Hamlet 's torture 's completely unbearable ) .
By 1855 , only six plays has left non - translated .
Russian society gradually begins appreciating Shakespeare 's skill in portraying the greatness , depth , and complexity of a human being .
" The sun of Russian poetry " , Alexander Pushkin , takes his English lessons for the sake of being able to read Shakespeare .
And his drama Boris Godunov is certainly inspired by Macbeth .
In the poetical drama Masquerade by other famous Russian poet , Mikhail Lermontov , we clearly read Othello 's features .
Since that time , Shakespeare has been one of our favorite artists .
The surprise of the weekend
First , I want to explain to you what happened to me on Saturday morning . I had to meet up with my friend Matus at 14 am , so when he told me that he could n't come over that if we could meet up later , how you can understand he made me so angry because I ca n't put up this kind of person who who is in late always .
On Saturday morning , I had to working and I had to do all the things as fast as was possible to be in the city centre at the exact time .
The worst part of the story was when he told me that he was going to have a lunch with his friends .
I got cold feet . I could n't understand what was happening .
I was supposed to we were going to have a lunch together , but he was going to come later .
Despite all , this I tried to calm myself down and I went to the library until laura came to town .
During the afternoon I tried to keep my smile all the time because I did n't fancy going explain what was wrong with me .
Finally yesterday at night , I was studying in my room when the doorbell rang . I went to opened the door and outside was , my friend Matus .
At the beginning , I did n't want to talk with him but , on second thought , all people deserve a second chance .
All in all , He apologized and at the end , everything is solved .
We will go on being friends .
Hello , my name is Sebastian and I will talk about Azul Historico , which is a restaurant in Mexico City .
The service are good , the waiters serve excellent , the food is delicious , but some periods of the year the place is full of people and you need a reserve or to wait a long time for a table .
It is so difficult to choose the three best dishes of the place but these three are some of the best typical food of Mexico : the " Cochinita Pibil " , " Chichilo Negro " and " Carne Enchipoclada " .
If you want a different and unique restaurant , you need to go to Azul Historico , because it has a delicious food , some times have a regional music and the service are excellent .

There are many different types of music in the world today .
Why do we need music ?
Is the traditional music of a country more important than the International music that is heard everywhere nowadays ?
Music is a special world .
Over decades , music is the eternally art which develop day by day .
The traditional or local music of a certain area has it 's thumb print on the person of that part of the world .
And the instruments used in that local music may vary from one sort to another .
Because the people tend to make it from their own basic culture .
For example , In Northern Sudan , people have been used " Tambor " as a traditional spiritual tool for their songs .
In particular , the Piano is a universal tool that is used by many musicians as a primary controller of the rhythm of the Orchestra .
Last and not the least , music is a sort of treatment to those who are suffering , so , regardless of it 's type or nationality , it 's a kind of medicine to the soul .
And I enjoy it very much .
The prohibition and destruction of books has occurred in historical periods as the inquisition , the knowledge was manipulated by the powerful social statements such as the Catholic Church and monarchies , since the knowledge through books had become a threat to continue underpinning their power within the social pyramid ; therefore , those powerful social statements chose what books did not violate their thought in order to transcribe them .
Although , some ideas were maintained ; ( for instance , the astronomy by Galileo Galilei ) , the book - burning caused a delay in the knowledge because , if books were burned , the knowledge could not circulate .
Nevertheless , a knowledge revolution was created with the invention of the printing mobile types by Gutenberg ( 1440 ) due to it element gave access to the knowledge , recovering significant books from Plato , Aristotle and so on , authors against political , religious and social issues that spread their ideas to more people who were becoming aware of the power of the written word , creating social revolutions such as the French and American ones .
In addition , it was produced the collective readings through the ecclesiastical method , with the purpose of disseminating the knowledge embodied in the books to all social classes .
On the other hand , at present , people identify another knowledge revolution , the internet , in which the access to the knowledge is easier and faster , leaving aside books .
From the above , as far as I am concerned , when Franklin Rosemont argues that " books can not be killed by fire .
People die , but books never die " , it depends on the historical time and the technical revolution of this time , taking into account that that knowledge uprising is always accompanied by a technical revolution which supports the entrance of the information ; for instance , in the inquisition , the knowledge was limited because it was embodied in books .
Although there was an oral tradition , the knowledge was accommodated to the political and religious thought of the speaker ; so , the most efficient and objective way to transmit the knowledge was by books , and it was not possible because of the burning .
Nonetheless , with the invention of the printing type mobile , the knowledge was different for the access to it .
If one book was burned , there were ten books more without restriction .
That is why ; I could accommodate the phrase by Franklin , saying that " the knowledge can not be killed by people because the knowledge is infinite . "
On actual days what we most need is to find ways to prevent childhood obesity because nowadays it is a very common sickness that attack more and more children everyday causing them to feel bad about themselves .
According to the CDC , the percentage of children age 6 to 11 years old has increased from 7% to about 18% in 32 years on the Unitated States .
This means that in the past tree decades , obesity has more than doubled in children , same that had diseases just like diabetes , ashtma , cardiovascular risk factors , mental health disorders and muskuloskeletal problems .
This disease is not just about all the physical and health consequences that sufferers have , but also the mental ones .
A lot of kids grow up with a different way to think just because of the damage that the little ones can cause , one example can be the famous " bullying " , the principal way that kids use to annoy the ones that looks different .
The best way we can prevent childhood obesity is by recommending all the families some different doctor that can help them to give a safe life to their children .
They might be there for you , preparing menus and a big extension of exercises that will help you and change your health and body , but only if you cooperate .

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately .
That morning his , grandmother went to the hospital because she had to do a surgery and she told him to buy some magazines for her , because at the hospital she 's be bored and she could n't get off of the bed for a few days .
So Peter went home to take his wallet , but before that he decide to take a nap because he was tired , so he started to sleep , but it ended up that he slept for over 3 hours and his mother started calling him at the telephone and she was really angry because he forgot to buy the magazines for his grandmother .
So he woke up and looked at his watch and knew that he had to buy them immediately or his mother would be even more angry than before .
He took his wallet and then he ran to buy the magazines and after that he went to the hospital to give them to his granny .
Unfortunately , the hospital was already closed to the visitors , so he had to wait until the next morning .
A FANTASTIC FUTURE
Will transport be different in the future ?
Certainly it will be .
But how ?
If we think about the future , some sketches of famous movies could come to our mind .
For example , we could think about some odd cars that can fly or become invisible .
Actually , in my opinion , in the future there will be faster transport .
In addition , means of transport will be able to produce less pollution .
And how will our way of travelling change ?
In the future , everyone will be able to go on holiday all around the world since the transport will be faster and cheaper .
To sum up , I think that means of transport in the future will make our life easier , both when we have to go to work or to school and when we want to travel .
Transport will also respect the environment and nature .
Do n't you think that this future is fantastic ?
since decades , man has preferred to use another way of transporting than using his own foot .
In my opinion , that was the main reason for the wheel invention .
Scientists could provide , in the past years , new transportation tools , from cycles , automobiles up to motorcycles , motorcars , trains , metros , that has been used to arrange and accomplish complete public transportation net through the same country , and sometimes exceeded it to another country 's boarder upon an agreement between those countries .
Many people assured that they are preferring using their own cars , but they were being forced to use the Public transport for many reasons , such as , the complexities they are facing with the driver 's license , in addition to the fuel high cost .
They were more likely forced rather than having to choosing it as an option .
Let 's do n't forget the hard times during cold weather changes , especially in winter , while reaching the bus stations , or their low chances of having a good place to sit , may be there is another important reason that raise the private transport 's scores than the public one , which is molestation .
The end

Art / Music is less important than science / technology .
As soon as we open our eyes every day , we begin to use technology , such as alarm , cell phone and light .
The more technology we use , the more important it is .
Technology makes us easy to connect with our family , friends and co - workers .
We can talk to our family and friends immediately , which is not limited by space .
I can call my dad who live in New York now , then call my friend living in Norway after the first call .
Therefore , if I had studied abroad fifty years ago , I could n't call my family directly and it is also not an easy job .

It is called " that 76 people are confirmed dead in a Colombian plane crash " .
A charter plane carrying 72 passengers , including players from Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense , crashed near Rionegro , Colombia , according to the country 's civil aviation department .
Nine crew members were also on board .
The civil aviation agency had initially announced that six passengers , three players , two crew members , and one journalist , survived the crash .

Thank you for your attention .
There are few ways that help us master it .
First of all , you need to preview .If you do this , and you 'll have a clear idea about what are you going to learn in class .
It'll make you learn faster .
Next , when you are in a class , focus on what the teacher says , she / he will teach you and give you a clearer understanding about grammar .
And they will also remind you about some key points you do n't understand when you preview it .
They'll be glad to help .
At last , when you learn some grammar concepts that are new to you , you need to practice them .It'll help you remember it and how to use it .
If you do all the things above , I promise your grammar will improve and you 'll master it eventually .

Taking care of our environment is considered , for many of us , one of the most important things in our lives .
Recycling is both a popular and an undervalued method .
Everybody knows what separate rubbish into different bins means , but , a big part of the society believes that it is not worth doing it if there are people that does not recycle .
I would answer to them that , then , how do they explain all the sheets of paper , crystal and plastic items that have been made of recycled materials , allowing us to save tons of primal resources ?
Using its respective light bulbs , household appliances and any other thing that saves energy is the only way that individuals can help but , it is not effective .
In this case , restrictions should be implemented by the government .
Taking everything into consideration , there is a good argument for supporting recycle , which is the following one : The biggest waste of energy take part in primal resources industries , if we reuse all the materials that had already been exploited , we would reduce at least half of its costs .

Japanese people take an interest in used clothes .
There is involved with a recycling spirits in the Edo period .
In the Edo period , there was the society that was called " super recycling - oriented society " .
Almost products and materials were recycled and changed into new products .
People did this without special efforts .
There were many specialists to repair , recycle and collect products in the Edo period .
Used clothes were sold by a " gyosyo " , that means peddler .
It was just the number of union members , so in fact , there were more secondhand clothing stores in the Edo period .
Kimono has a very simple structure .
After that , western clothes became popular in Japan and , the recycling system was forgot for a long time .
However , secondhand clothing stores are increasing in recent years .
There are many secondhand clothing stores now .

MY FAVOURITE SPORT
Choosing a sport to practise is a complicated thing . You should choose something that you enjoy , but at the same time , something you can afford to pay for .
As a result of that , I have tried many sports in my life .
My favourite is diving .
Although you may think that is a dangerous sport , which it can be , the adrenaline rush you feel when you are in the water makes it worth the danger .
It is very important to check the equipment first .
If you are not used to do it , you can make a mistake , and then it is when the sport became dangerous .
After a few lessons , you will be able to go diving on yourself and enjoy the sensation of freedom that provides you this sport .
I encourage you to try it .

It is often said , that shopping is a pleasant procedure , but sometimes it becomes bothersome .
However , there are situations we do not find enjoyable at all .
I will mention some of the reasons why and times when shopping can be unenjoyable .
Firstly , when we do not have enough time in the morning to go shopping , we have to do it in the evening when most people go and buy things they need .
Shopping may cause frustration , mainly , when we have to squeeze through the crowd .
Secondly , shopping definitely become unenjoyable when we are not able to find products we want and desire .
Shops use a lot of tricky ways to encourage people to buy more than they need .
To conclude , we have to know when and to which shop we should go to avoid stressful and not enjoyable situations .
Probably one of the most discussed topics - global warming , is also the most serious issue ; world is facing today .
Researchers have proved that human activities such as industrialization , deforestation etc . can trigger global warming .
One of the most evident effects of global warming is the depletion of the ice at the North & South poles , in turn causing the sea level to rise and encroachment of land .
There are scientific evidences , that calamities like Katrina and , Hud - Hud can be linked to global warming .
For example , governments can impose limits on emissions produced by manufacturing plants and force industries to help in forestation .
Individuals can also play their part in controlling global warming .
For example , individuals can reduce the use of the plastic materials , use public transport to control emission , recycle waste material etc .
To conclude , global warming is a serious concern which can not be ignored any longer .
Government & Individual both have a role to play , in facing this the biggest challenge of the Time , Earth is facing .

After I joined ACU ( Australian Catholic University ) , I have found vast differences in teaching method between Nepal and Australia .
In Nepal , students study individually , do not ask questions with the tutor even if they are confused .
Meanwhile , Australian education is based on making students learn new skills .
Besides , students are able to raise questions with the lecturer because they can express their opinion .
At first , I felt difficult , stressed while studying in groups and used to hesitate while sharing my ideas , opinion , but now I am familiar with the academic culture .
Academic culture is a challenge for many students for effective learning .
Peer learning is a small group of three to five students who are kept together to discuss the content and carry out educational activities in mutual engagement .
( Fisher , as cited in Strake , 2010 , p.2 ) , Peer learning is a two - way learning process in which members of a group feel it easier to discuss the content .
It helps to know the importance of group work by giving and receiving feedback on particular tasks .
According to Hamp ( 2002 ) , the goal of an EAP ( English For Academic Purpose ) course is to teach students relevant study skills they need throughout their degree .
It helps to share the ideas , knowledge , among the students and make them think critically , by using formal language while writing , and so on .
In conclusion , the adoption of the Australian academic culture has developed strategies for my learning .
In the future , I will enhance my learning strategies by working actively in group .

For many years , Apple , Google and several traditional automakers have been running prototypes , which are driving from self and nobody can steer the car .
The question arises if driverless cars will be a boon or a bane to us ?
First of all , self driving cars are good for people who have got a handicap .
At the moment , people who has got a handicap can not drive a car on theirself .
When this people can drive a self - driving car , the feel more comfortable and the can live more freely .
Similarly important is the fact that self - driving cars are more saftier as no self - driving cars .
Is car driving really safe ?
Self - driving cars are steered by a very modern software and this software is so exactly that the number of accidents will be decline .
In contrast , self driving cars are very expensice and much people can not buy it .
Self - driving cars are very modern and drive with a very highly technically software .
Rich people can buy it but people of the middle class can not .
In the future , this can make a highly gap between poor and rich people .
This is the reason why self - driving cars can be in the near future only something for rich people .
The automobilindustries have to work on a plan so that self - driving can be bought by people oft he middle class too .
When this will be going on self - driving cars can be an enrichment for our life .

PUBLIC TRANSPORT .
Nowadays , travel in public transport has been an experience who none has failed .
However , there exist now a discussion about what the people prefer , if the public transport or the vehicule of oneself .
Exist a lot of benefits of the public transport , at the start , you do nt have to drive yourself , you can listen to music , read a book o wathever you want without have to pay attention to the traffic , is true , too , that travel by this way of transport help the goverment because you have to pay for it , and the majority of them are cheap enought to everyone .
However , so much people love have their own vehicule , a car , a bick , a moto , because this give you other kind of freedom , you chose the way , you chose the time , you chose the way in you drive it , the positive thing about this kind of vehicule is that you do nt have to take a bus , for example , crowded of people , you can go alone in your car , or with whoever you want , but the important thing is that you chose .
In conclusion , we can say that every kind of transport has their own pros and cons , but in my opinion , the difference between both of this is that in the secon you chose you own style .
Extremadura is a small place where you can not find many transport types .
The car is a quick , cheap and easy mode of transport since you can use it when you want and you can park it where you want .
When you use the car , you do not have to think in timetables and you do n't have to pay for expensive tickets for travelling .
However , I think that this mode of transport has some disadvantages , for instance : if in a small city there are a lot of cars , the pollution will increase and the environment will be injured .
Also , when a city is small , the people should walk to different places since everything is near to your houses .
I think that the urban buses have improved in Cáceres .
Now , it is securier to travel than in last years .
In the bus stop there are devices that advice to the people of the minutes that they have to wait to the arrived of the bus .
Finally , in Extremadura , the transport least used is the train .

4 . Do you learn more at school or on placement ?
Where do you actually learn more , at school or on placement ?
First of all , before arguing this question , it is important to compare the answers with people who are on the same education and at the same school .
Because there can be a lot of differences in the characteristics of those two subjects .
After that , having said that , I can clearly write down my opinion about this question .
I think that at my school the balance of this civil education is n't right and fair at all .
Because the numbers of theory lessons about our discipline are by far many hours less than I expected to get .
This makes it nearly a complete self - study education , which should n't be that way at this level of schooling .
So because of this , the placement is always a step ahead to choose for at this question because they will teach you directly more .
In addition , on placement , the things you learn are always focused on that particular job and company .
So the details and information they teach you will be more useful in your future career than the random information about the subjects at school .
So this makes it already two against zero for the placement .
And finally , the third and last reasons why I think you learn more on placement than at school .
When you go to school you have to follow lessons which are , off course , useful for your knowledge , but , the way of following this lessons are not a natural work pattern .
In a natural work pattern , you have to do , also like school , your tasks , but the communication is also an important part of it .
This important way of communication lacks at school , because it 's a nearly a one direction way of communicating from the teachers .
While on placement , they work more in an evaluating way to improve skills .
So , with the these three arguments all going in the same direction to explain my opinion at this question , I think it has not to be explained any further now .
The necessity has declined that working and living needs to be fairly close to each other .
Managing long distances seems to be normal nowadays .
Moreover , people enjoy being unbound and , therefore , they are willing to travel long distances .
Some people go even so far and do n't to assume that public transport will not have a future at all .
Especially in the countryside , public transport is no alternative to cars , due to the lack of frequency .
Consequently , people prefer taking the car .
Travelling by train as a family or group is often far more expensive than taking the car .
Nevertheless , public transport still provides several advantages in comparison to taking the car .
However , it will remain in the future , as still many people use it or even depend on it .
The purpose of this report is to inform you about how the city of Granada take care of the envirnoment .
Rubbish and pollution
There are a lot of recycling points of plastic , paper , used oil , glass and batteries .
As for pollution , it refers , in spite of to have a decent public transport system , Granada is one of the worst cities of Spain .
Clean Infrastructures
How was said , Granada have a decent public transport system and now it is being improved by adding a metropolitan train .
However , Granada can not be considerer as Ciclyng Friendly , there is less ciclyng roads than in other cities of a similar size .
In addition , the oldtown is not as involved as it should be in clean behaviour , it being the University who make the biggest effort .
Summing Up
I considerer that Granada score 6.5 out of 10 about taking care of the envirnoment .
It was built in 1754 and renovated in 2007 and nowadays you can see the new face of this amazing place .

I can assure you you will never get bored with this place and all things things connected with the Big Castle will make it memorable for you .
Hope you will enjoy your stay .

That is what I say that the fewer children can get more resource and are easier to be raise .

For instance , in the big city , we can very easy to find the specific space to serve our children , such as special toilet and a Breast - Feeding Room in every subways .
These kinds of space can make parents comfortable and able to concentrate on their children 's care .
On the other hand , the software infrastructures are important as well as hardware system .

Having a healthy lifestyle is one of the most important things for our health , because it reduces the chances of getting sick and it gives you the energy and concentration you need .
But what should you do in order to live a healthy life ?
Eating on a schedule is a very important tip you should take in consideration , and also , trying to avoid fried meals or fast food .
Fruits , vegetables and water
They would help you immune system , and your skin and will also give you the amount of energy you need throughout the whole day .
However , drinking 2 litters of water everyday is essential to your health and has a lot of benefits , such as helping energising your muscles or keeping your skin look good .
Sports and sleep
It will give you a lot of energy to study and do the things you love , while feeling healthy and living healthy .
Besides that , you should also sleep between 8 - 10 hours per night , so that your body can function effectively .
Do 's
-eat fruits and vegetables
-drink water
-sleep 8 - 10 hours / night
-do sports
Do n't 's
-eat a lot of Fast Food
-be lazy

According to a study published by the journal « American Journal of Medicine Brevintev » in August / August next that the more public transport in the city , where the population has become leaner and healthier .
The U.S. researchers from two universities in the state of Pennsylvania and the Foundation « Rand » American research and development staff to monitor regularly attend public transportation or go to work by car within a year .
The study results showed that people who ride transportation .
The public decreased their weight by three kilograms on average , compared to people who use the car to move and the study attributed this result to walk to the bus stop and running to catch the bus in the expected position requires goer public transport more traffic , while this does not happen with motorists .

Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately .
He got that mysterious look in his eyes .
He just realized how to solve one of the biggest physical challenges mankind has been interested in for ages .
We had been looking at this problem from the wrong angle all the time .
The periodic move of the minute hand compared to the smooth path of the seconds hand .
We were trying to reverse the flow of time , but that is not possible at all .
We have to focus on the breaks .
Time is running , seemingly continuously , the same as the seconds hand on his clock .
But we got this perception just because our eye can see only a limited number of images in a time period .
If a time period is long enough , like a minute , we can see a strict distinction between one and two .
That is the key !
Then we can just jump inside it and move in either direction , as we wish .
Peter grabbed his notebook and immediately wrote all this down .

As a result , there is the debate about whether educational institutes have a responsibility to dissuade students from pursuing a field of study in which they are unlikely to succeed .
In my opinion , I agree with the statement , with qualifications , by the following reasons .
Admittedly , some of the research need to invest in many resources that educational institutes can not afford .
However , if there is not a lack of the resource for the field of study , Educational institutes should support students for their study area .

Once , people think he would not succeed .
In the course of the research , students will think about how to develop the process of the research and know which segment will cause the problem that making the research fail .
In addition , students , in the course of research , maybe create serendipity .

The invaluable thing is to turn the impossibility to a possibility .

Most people in Bali rely too much toward their private vehicles , hence they have totally abandoned public transportation .
They say , " there is no future for public transport , because travelling by car is so much more convenient " .
I believe that we can do it here .
In order to do that , it will cost us a huge transformation .
Aside from a great blue - print of a well - organized transportation system , which covers a good 25 to 50 years ' planning , it also involves local culture .
A conscience that a change is needed to create a better place for people to live in should arise first .
People should be reminded that 50 to 100 people travelling in a bus will make the traffic so much better compared to have each two to four of them trap in a car , in other words , one massive transportation measure against twelve or more cars on the same road .
Imagine the energy that we can keep and the pollution that we can stop .
The world is constantly changing and technology is advancing fast .
This affects people 's lives considerably , so we can say that in 50 years , the lifestyle will be completely different to what we have today .
We can say that 50 years ago we had not thought of to have technology that currently exists , such as the Internet , TV , smartphones , etc .
Also , the lifestyle was completely different , the industry had not developed technology that now allows you to be more efficient and several people did the work that now can be done with a few of them .
So , if technology continues to advance as it has done until now , our lifestyle will change too .
Perhaps in 50 years more , we will live in a world where technology makes our life much easier , but at the same time , we will be depending on it .

Public transport is a common means of transport used in many countries ; Usually to transport people in mass from one location to another ;
However , as the countries develop and the economy grows and life change , people change and standards of life change too ; The interaction factors that lead people to have their own a car is depending on and limiting on several factors ; There are also factors such as social and financial conditions that tend to influence people to have their own car instead to travel by public bus / train ; We should also consider the conditions of roads , access and traffic , giving an opportunity to people to opt and to travel on their own car or on public transport ; In some countries , there are separate lanes dedicated for public transport which help and facilitate the traffic on condition of heavy traffic ; With traffic technology solution , owning a car is always better .
another factor we should consider is the public transport stops on the way to destination , which require to plan and catch up public transport to avoid late arrival at your destination .
The subject , no future for public transport is ambiguous as the advantages and disadvantages are both consider on .

Public transport is a useful way to commute from place to place , especially in big cities .
Besides its advantages , which are that it are cheap and fast , there are many disadvantages of taking a bus or train , such as time , quality of serving , and crowdedness .
it is said that , instead of taking public transport , commuters will travel by car because of its convenience . in my opinion ,
First of all , Public transport is used by many people who do not have cars , like students and workers . They can afford to buy tickets .
For example , during my student time , I used to take busses to go to school every day and come back home .
Traffic jams always happen in the rush hours , when there are so many cars on the road .
It has been affecting to the environment , like climate change , increasing droughts , and flooding areas thanks to increasing the demands of using petrol for private cars .
Introduction
Currently , the local modes of transport available are buses and taxis .
Buses in need of repair
Most of them do n't have air conditioning , meaning that in the summer they are tremendously hot , and some have problems with the windows that cause the bus to be extremely cold in winter .
The alternative - Taxis
For the average middle - aged person , the logical option is to use a taxi .
Taxis are available throughout the city , and can be called by a simple phone message .
Recommendation
Another option would be to create a system to rent bicycles ; this has been done in many cities with great results .

The statement given in the rubric proposes an issue of the future of pulic transport in developed countries .
Modern megapolises are suffering from a surplus of automobiles .
It happens not only because of environmental aspect , but mental aspects as well .
Thus , it is absolutely possible wish of the average person , who spends most of the time in downtown , to replace a car for a bus or an underground train .
The main reason is general fatigue from the huge number of vehicles around .
Whatever type of journey you took , you would be more likely to prefer using a train or plane , because it would be much more convenient and would not demand any physical tension .
Overall , there are a number of causes to disagree with the suggestion , that individual transport is getting more and more popular in comparison with public transport .
The only thing , that definitely should be changed in the future , is an approach to the usage of cars powered by gasoline .

Reflective Writing
I have done to take responsibility for my own learning .
Independent learning has become an indispensable part of finishing tertiary - level education successfully .
Compared with EAP course , it tend to be taken responsibility for finishing assessments independently , especially for academic writing .
Firstly , it was too difficult for me to hand in assessments on time , because I used to spend too much time on playing games without teachers ' supervision , so that I always did not have enough time for finishing academic assignments independently .
In this sense , the term , " time management " means the ability of controlling time on prioritizing tasks , and planning the effective scheduling of time to balance study and work , and keeping concentration on motivating yourself to learning towards a goal ( Academic Skills Unit , 2012 , pp.22 - 25 ) .
Rowh ( 2006 ) states that you will stay up late for accomplishing assessments before the deadline is due without planning in advance .
Based on examining my actual experience and research , I noticed that a gap , unsuccessful time management in independent learning , is the root cause of these problems .
Then I made a few conscious changes that I began to manage the duration for finishing my homework ahead of some weeks , as well as stopping procrastinating in the most important areas of my life .
As an independent learner , it is my sole responsibility to autonomic learning , which is a very important factor in future for passing EAP1 successfully , as well as giving me an advantage in terms of coping with the challenges of my future Bachelor of Nursing in Australia .

In this set of materials , the listening passage discusses the advantages of alcohol and how they contribute to improve health , and personality , and the reading contradict this by revealing the down side of it .
In the listening passage , the professor discusses the advantages of alcohol and how it helps to reduce heart attacks and strokes by 40 percent , due to the fact that it reduce blood clot , and slowing down the deterioration of brain function .
In addition , moderate drinking helps to keep healthy movement , because some researches has shown that people who drink moderately have a less proportion of body fat , because alcohol speed up the metabolism , which makes calories burn quickly .
Moreover , it is stated that people who drink moderately have positive social behavior , which means that they are more likely to establish contact than non - drinker , and they are more social , popular and they are more likely to be married .
On the other hand , the reading contrast with this by mentioning the disadvantages of alcohol .
Firstly , it is stated that alcohol lead to weight gain , because it has more calories per gram than any other drink , and it is mentioned in the passage that you need to walk a mile to lose the calories of a glass of wine .
Furthermore , studies have shown that alcohol induce the appetite , which makes people consume more than they need .
For example , researchers have found that belly fat is related to alcohol .
Second , alcohol can cause some serious health issues , especially cirrhosis of the liver , heart failure , brain damage and a variety of cancers .
In fact , studies shows that 86 percent of all homicides and 60 percent of sexual assaults , are linked to alcohol .
Firstly , there is a benefit of globalization that people can buy some special products from various countries on the internet instead of buying in the production site .
So transportation of goods has become an important link for both the public and businesses .
In recent years , there are some different size of logistic companies have been hold , and different modes of transportation has developed rapidly .
For example , in the past , the main modes of transportations were ships , trains and trucks , so people had to wait a long time for their parcels and letters .
However , now , the increasing number of consumers and logistic companies has chosen airplanes , which can save much time to transport their parcels .
The reason is that the development of globalization has let our country improve its economy .
However , because of the increasing standard of living , a growing number of people have chosen to travel , which has brought a heavy pressure of transportation .
So in order to transport a huge number of visitors who are not only foreigners but also native people , the government and experts have to think of some different ways to solve this problem .
For example , some cities like Beijing and Hangzhou have to limit the number of cars which come for traveling to decrease the pressure of transportation in sight spots and city centre .
So in my opinion , people need to find the right ways to let globalization push the standard of our living whereas discussing its advantages and disadvantages .

With a thousand years of built and fight for the liberty of our nation , we can be proud of our history .
Vietnam is a small country but it had defeated two big nations which wanted to turn Vietnam into their colony .
With strong patriotism , the Vietnameses nowadays are trying to develop the nation , to get in the globalization progress .
However , as a resident of the country , we can not forget about the history and about our ancestors ' services rendered to the nation as well as our culture and ideology .
As a reward for their efforts .
We can mention many places , such as Sword Lake , Hỏa Lò prison , the Temple of Literature ...
Today , I will mention about one of the iconic places of Vietnam which you can not miss when you travel to Vietnam .
It is the Temple of Literature , the first university of the nation .
The Temple of Literature was built in 1070 , under the Ly 's dynasty .
In spite of wars and the destruction of time , the Temple of Literature is still preserved in good shape until now .
We can still see many ancient structures which show the main trend of architecture at that time .
He built up a system which was based on 4 essential relationships in the society .
We can briefly describe the overall structure of the Temper of Literature , which consists of six parts .
Firstly , there were 3 main gates , the center one only for the king , the left side one was for administrators , the right site one was for the military .
Scholars only could enter by a small gate from the aside .
Then there are five courtyards from the first one to the fifth one from outside to inside .
One remarkable , featured point about Temple of Literature is that the people who passed 4 rounds of examination , then gained position titles would be graved their names on the stone grave carried on stone turtles .
Right at the moment of entering , you can see them from two sides of the courtyards .
The Temple of Literature is a hollow place for students even now .
The Temple or Literature ( or Imperial Academy ) can be seen as the most featured historical place in Vietnam .
It contains not only the history but also the culture , customs , also it is the first official institute which you can not miss out .

Topic : Mt . Fuji
In Japan , there are many interesting places to visit .
For example , Kyoto is a popular place to visit because it has a lot of invaluable temples .
Sapporo is an attractive place because the raw fish and vegetables are fresh and nice to eat .
Among these places , Mt .
Fuji is the most wonderful place in Japan . Because its scenery is so beautiful , it is a popular place and it offers several exciting activities .
The first reason is Mt .
Fuji has very beautiful scenery .
For instance , in winter , Mt .
The white Mt .
Fuji is very beautiful , so it has been the subject of countless works of art , such as the ' Thirty - six Views of Mt. Fuji ' , a series of " ukiyo - e " paintings by Hokusai .
Also , in summer , almost all the snow on Mt Fuji melts and it changes to brown and green colors .
At a summer sunset , Mt .
Fuji is so majestic that many pictures and paintings have been done of Mt .
Fuji at sunset .
Depending on the season , Mt .
Fuji makes various beautiful sights and it always fascinates many people .
The second reason is that Mt .
Fuji is a popular mountain .
A lot of travelers and climbers come to climb the mountain and more than 200,000 people climb to the top of Mt .
Fuji in a year .
In addition , many cameramen and painters come to record the beautiful landscape of Mt .
Fuji .
Also , many observers of weather , stars or space come here , since this is an important place to observe weather , stars and space .
The last reason is that Mt .
Fuji offers several exciting leisure activities .
Climbing to the top of Mt .
Fuji is allowed in late July and August .
Fuji .
This marathon is very hard due to severe conditions of low oxygen and a steep slope , so people who are proud of having a strong body try this marathon .
Furthermore , around Mt .
Fuji , there are five beautiful lakes and many hot springs .
Japan has a lot of good places for relaxing , but the best place is Mt .
Fuji .
Mt .
Fuji has beautiful scenery , it is popular and it offers exciting activities for people .

Story
The doorbell ran .
When I opened the door , imagine my surprise , as there was nobody standing .
NO one at all .
I could only feel a hot , smelly stream of wind . '
There must have been a naughty child ' , I thought , without worrying .
Later on the week , I was doing the dishes when the kitchen door suddenly opened for no reason however I felt the same hot wind in my face and smelled the same funny smell .
That was when I first started to believe that something wrong was happening at home .
The next time it happened to me such a thing I felt no wind but smelled this particular stink .
It was as if somebody was cooking some cauliflower .
At that time , I was unemployed , so I was n't able to move house and as I was n't afraid of it I had to put up with those strange events .
So , I decided not to pay any attention to it and to carry on with my normal life .
Now I have to admit that I have a problem . I am sharing my home with a ghost or two , but I do n't mind as long as he or she leaves me alone .
My name is Cristina and I am 19 years old . I think I am the suitable person because I have been working with children for quite a long time .
My parents both have been working since I was 12 , so I had to take care of my little sister , who is four years younger than me .
For this reason , I have been doing three courses during this year .
These are quite interesting and have helped me to know deeper children 's pleasures .
I have learnt a lot of activities which let them have fun at the same time as they get in touch with nature .
I am able to cook some delicious dishes too .
I have to practise more , but I think I am qualified enough to do this activity .
I am available all summer , so I could start to work whenever you would need me to .
Good afternoon .
This month , on the 9'th I 'm going to have an oral and writing examination on my English language knowledge .
The English language is a foreign language for me , but I have studied it for ten years and hopefully I will manage to pass the exam .
I have three more days to prepare myself better , but to be honest , I 'm not in the mood of studying .
I 'm going to travel all the way to the capital of my country , approximately three hundred and fifty kilometres .
I called a girl who is a colleague of mine from another airport .
In fact , she will also participate in the exam .
Hopefully , I will pass the exam and will attend the English course for a month .
Afterwards , I will have the right to take part to the intarnational missions for maintaining the peace under the patronage of the European Union .
I am writing in regard to the environmental problem you are researching .
First of all , I am going to present to you some general information about the environment in our village .
- Our village has only 200 citizens , therefore the amount of rubbish produced in a year is insignificant to the environment in our area .
- 60 percent of the houses in the village have solar panels .
- There are separate rubbish bins for plastics , metal and glass in the whole area .
In conclusion , I would say that our village is an example for an environmentally conscious city .
Kalina Yevtushenkova .
Report : How Budapest takes care of its environment ?
In the new buildings , there are usually dustbins for each type of material ( glass , plastic , etc . ) , and around the older buildings there are more and more separate dustbins .
And it is a serious problem , because in the not so distant future , we wo n't be able the handle the garbage - it wo n't be enough space where we could deposit that .
In that area , Budapest accomplishes very awful .
Naturally , it 's mainly depends on us : if we could put our garbage into the dustbin , instead of letting it on the streets , it would be easier to keep it clean .
However , it would n't be impossible to collect the rubbish and clean the streets more often - it 's just a matter of organisation .
Since yoga entered my life , I try to change my common view of many things .
My lifestyle is among them .
The ecological situation is seriously bad , not only in my city , but in my country in general .
Rubbish recycle is the biggest problem in Kyyiv , in my opinion .
What a smell !
But people mostly do n't care about it .
We keep on generating rubbish and using harmful things .
Not to mention diapers and sanitary towels , paper napkins and many other things .
Unfortunately , we do n't separate rubbish .
Can you imagine why ?
Because recycling is hardly developed here , in Ukraine .
For a very long time I 've been doing my best to separate rubbish , and then , it was a really bright summer morning , I saw that the special yellow bin for paper and glass was emtied by the same car with the other rubbish ...
Once again , there 's only one bin for every group of rubbish .
First of all , I have provided experience working with children in that range of age .
I have taken courses about First Aid Kit and even I am doing a course as a personnel training for children with some delay and disability .
Secondly , I have been working in a restaurant for more than five years .
Starting there , beginning as a dishwasher , being promoted until I got the main position as a Chef .

Yours faithfully ,
DANTE LOZANO .
Although it is true that shopping might not be a very interesting topic , it must be stated that it is necessary .
There are many different kinds of shopping : e.g. clothes , groceries , furniture , instruments , etc .
It all depends on what you are about to buy .
When it comes to clothes , there are also different kinds of people , the ones who do it for necessity and the ones who do it for joy .
Groceries and furniture , as well as instruments , follow the same pattern .
In last place , it is undoubtedly influenced by the place in which you are buying ( i.e. the room , the organization , the prices , the distance , etc ) and the unknown people who are in it , which may cause trouble or facilitate your shopping and make it more enjoyable .
In order for it to happen , a range of different variables have to take place .
Owning a motorbike has advantages .
In addition , as it is smaller than a car , parking becomes much less complicated .
Besides , for the same reason , it is easier to avoid traffic jams .
On the other hand , motorbikes do also have drawbacks .
Another disadvantage this kind of vehicle has is the low number of passengers who can travel on a motorbike . Consequently , not everybody finds it convenient or comfortable owning one .
In conclusion , owning a motorbike can be useful or useless depending on the lifestyle you have , your economic status , and the number of people you need to travel with .

The world where we live now is more suitable for young people , as many could say and prove , even though , in some countries , older people can have a decent life without depending on young people .
But , unfortunately , the new gadgets can be very difficult to manage or master , especially for the part of the population who did not learn about them while they were children or students at the university ( older people ) .
On the other hand , to someone who did not have these when they were more young and more active , such as grandmothers and grandfathers , the new instruments are just things that they can not use nor understand .
The older people are limited in their abilities to use technology that could be valuable to provide enjoyable times at home , on the street , in a museum , etc .
Since last century , the world population is more present in the bigger cities , which , as a result , have been increasing in size and in problems .
The urbanization implemented by government across the decades in the cities are sometimes not suitable for all members of the public .
The mobility of older people is certainly reduced if compared with a younger person .
In this case , they do not have the possibility to go out and enjoy the benefits that cities may bring to their lives .

Introduction
The aim of this report is to give my opinion about the facilities and services of the Active Leisure Clubs .

Advantages

The activities are expensive .
Recommendations
It 's recommend that you improving the facilities , falling in the price and opening every day until 10.00 p.m.
Since the car was invented , we have been seeing a large increase of cars ' production and of its use .
In the early days , the public transport system was n't very efficient , as it was in its beginning .
Nowadays , they got modern and comfortable and they are n't as late as they used to be .
Travelling by car might be more pleasant , but it can also be costly , for fuel can be very expensive , depending on the current economy .
With regards to traffic , travelling by public transport can also be quicker , as there is a bus lane and no traffic for the tube .
However , over the past years , people have been travelling mostly by car , which seems to have led to higher levels of air pollution .
This is undoubtedly an important environmental issue that should definitely have our attention .
In spite of all the campaigns aiming to the less use of the car but more of the public transport , people still seem to prefer to travel by car .

INTRODUCTION
It is one of the best places in our town where teenagers can develop their artistic skills .
GOOD POINTS
The school provides lots of different activities for those who are interested in music , drawing , dance and theatre .
More than that , all the classes are free .
The atmosphere at school is very creative .
During the whole school year , a great number of exhibitions , concerts and performances are given by pupils themselves and by invited musicians and artists as well .
BAD POINTS
The worst thing about the school is that not everyone can be accepted to study there .
Children have to take an entrance examination .
CONCLUSION
It is definitely worthwhile to study there , although it is advised to let students choose the activities they prefer .
The phenomenon of homeless people became a serious problem and many countries can not solve this problem .
First of all , being without a home is a horrible problem .
One of the major reasons for this problem is wars , especially in the Arab countries like Syria , Libya and Yemen .
Everyday on the news We see the refugees who are living in a miserable condition .
They do not have enough food .
After a while , the people who are laid off will not have enough money to live , and they will become homeless people .
Cases of divorce are increasing and many children escape and prefer to live in the street instead of in a home full of problems .

They appeared first in Blink , one of the Doctor Who episodes .
After Blink was broadcasted , it raised common fears about statues to tele - viewers in Britain and all over the world .
These results are interesting because Weeping Angels are not the old adversaries of the Doctor , like the Daleks , exterminating all organic and inorganic things in the whole universe , or the Cybermen , transforming all living things into cyborg .
Then , what makes the Weeping Angels frightening ?
To figure out the factors , an uncanny theory is used .
This uncanny theory explains an uncomfortable sensation originated from perceiving something familiar as unfamiliar .
In Blink , the Weeping angels ' uncanny traits and awkward backgrounds in the drama make the audience have a scary and unfamiliar sensation .
And the expressions in their eyes are completely lacklustre , due to the deficiency of pupil .
These factors make angels more like grotesque psycho - pass assassin .
By the way , the exterior traits of Weeping Angels are not enough to make people scared .
But when it comes to their interior factor , the uncanny feelings are maximised by turning an unconscious physiological reaction into a conscious one .
Then , strangely , blinking our eyes becomes a conscious behaviour .
Moreover , there are good scene settings to make people not blink by immersing the audience in that situation .
In several scenes , Weeping Angels , the lonely assassins , never shift their positions and postures , even though the protagonists and supporting players blink , look away or turn their backs .
Why do they not move , even if their prey is near ?
To change the pose of the horrific statues technically , directors hide the angels by actors closing and opening the door or conceal the angels behind the actors through panning cameras horizontally , for a moment .
At last , directors fade out the scenes by flicking out the light bulb in the basement for maximizing the threat of the Weeping Angels !
After Sally , the heroine of Blink , takes the TARDIS key away from the Weeping Angels in the deserted house , they shadow her quietly , as if they might be laid there for a long time .
Consequently , it makes the audience unfamiliar with their circumstances .
Then tele - viewers are terrified at the basis of their livelihoods and people grab up blankets tight !
Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her .
Her family was very proud of her .

Her grandfather , the first doctor in the family , was her authority .
The greatest wish of her life was to work alongside him in the hospital .
From now on , Anna would have to direct her attention to making her grandfather proud of her degrees .
She intended to prove that medicine is a suitable field of study for her .
MY FAVOURITE SPORT

Curiously , there are many ways for taking care of yourself when you are taking up this sport , so what I advise you to do is to do some exercise before you go in the pitch , so it not only prevent you to suffer from spraid or other kind of injuries , but maintain you active to keep your game level .

In Japan , there are many rules that are set in the Sento .
Japanese , as pointed out by Trompenaars ( cited in Morrison , 2006 ) , is highly influenced by the values of universalism .
The main reason for Japanese people that they always follow the rules is to respect and a hope not to cause any confusion to other users .
Also , Japanese people think highly of the enjoyment of bathing in a clean environment .
As a result , in Australia , conflicts may be caused due to the high level of indulgence and individualism in Australian culture ( Hofstede 1994 ) , people may usually emphasize in their self - satisfaction and think of themselves first , instead of the public .
They may not consider the public interest and not give precedence to other users .
Consequently , the bathing pool may face the hygienic problems , such as someone does not wash before bathing , and scrambling issues .
In order to achieve cost efficiency , the choice of locations and decor must be thoroughly considered .
A location , whether it has a sufficient quantity of water or not , is the essential consideration .
Rental cost is also a limitation , as it is relatively higher in Australia .
Dear John ,
I am writing to recommend a place you should definitely visit while you 're in Poland .
The place I 'm writing about is Wawel Royal Castle in Cracow .
It is not only one of the most important monuments in the whole country , but also a beautiful place to visit .
It 's a huge , breath - taking complex of historical buildings and royal gardens .
The place is fascinating , because it is loaded with history and it 's nice to spend a day and relax in the royal gardens .
I also recommend going to the vaults under the cathedral , where since the 16th century , many kings and famous Polish people have had their graves .
It is well known in the whole of Europe and many foreigners are coming to Poland just to see the Cracow city and , among other things , the Wawel Castle .
I also thoroughly recommend Cracow in general as a place to visit , because it is beautiful , full of other worth - seeing monuments , cute small cafes , a various choice of restaurants and vivid hotels with great views on the riverside .
Yours faithfully

First of all , they are supposed to be desighed with great care and many considerations , such as the background colour , artwork and security issues , all of which are crucial for bank notes .
Secondly , skilled machinists will make preparations for the metal plates that are one of the most vital ways to ensure the quality of bank notes .
Thirdly , sheets of bank notes will be printed with colour on both sides , usually 50 bank notes per sheet .
In this step , special ink will be used for the images , which are slightly raised on the notes .
Printed sheets will be manually inspected .
There are two ways for these notes after this step .
On the other hand , if they are bad sheets or in bad condition , they will be disposed of securely .

I completely disagree with the statement " there is no future for public transport " .
I do believe that with time people become more conscious of the idea of cities being convenient to everyone .
Despite private car is more convenient to its owner then public transport , it is not in use the majority of the time and that means wasting city space for parking while it could be used as a public space .
At the same time , it is not impossible to solve the task of comfort and efficacy simultaneously .
For instance , a network of taxi cabs with affordable prices could combine the comfort of a personal car and the work - load of public transportation .
Nowadays , all the car manufacturers have accepted the task of design robot - driven car that in future would resolve the issue of safety and availability of taxi 24 hours 7 days a week .
Unfortunately , the main method is to make private cars , if not a luxury , then to make their usage economically less efficient in favour to public transportation .
And the underground , and light tram system are still more ecological and fast .

Green house gases have put a red light warning on the planet , and countries around the world are starting to realize the importance of reducing these gases .
Big cities are crowd with vehicles and , as a result , levels of pollution are dangerously increasing .
Enginers are studying new engines that are more nature friendly , but even so , we have to reduce vehicles to help reduce the green house effects and pollution .
Use public transport is a way to be green and help to improve our planet , and that is a very important task for all of us .
I do not agree with the statement that there is no future for public transport .
From the Metro system , the bus , the train , and the high speed rail , all these public transportation has become more and more popular .
Lots of people really enjoy the moment when taking public transportation because they are more convenient , cost less and is more eco - friendly .
In my opinion , taking public transport is more convenient .
We do n't have to drive by ourselves , and we do n't have to think about which way we should go to reach the destination .
What we have to do is simply go to the public transport stations and there will be vehicles that will take us to anywhere we want .
Finally , taking public transport is more eco - friendly .
Our mother earth has suffered from air pollution for a long period of time , which leads to the greenhouse effect and the rise of the average sea level .
We do n't want these natural disorders to continue .
From this point of view , I do n't think public transport has no future .
You may think of the time machine , but it would only be seen on a movie .
Is there no future for public transport ?
Since a century , many transports have been invented , therefore , our lives have become convenient .
We can easily travel around the world .
What transportation do we need and should be invented now is hard to think , because there is no place we could n't go .
Although the public transport is enough for people 's need , it can be improved its function .
With the advance of technology , a lot of problems have come to pass , the natural resources are becoming in storted , and the air pollution is getting worse .
This is harmful to everything in the world .
It can have benefits but also some drawbacks .
It can have an influence at their work .
They can have a better position , work for a foreign company , communicate with foreign companies , etc .
Also , you can be part of travelling and working experience which can offer to you your school .
It is very good that , these days , schools offer you more languages for learning to choose from and they recommend learning at least 2 foreign languages .
Of course , it can be different in each country .
Another very important benefit of learning a new language is that you can travel . You will understand people abroad and you will know how to communicate with them .
For example , which way you should go , where is a good restaurant , how to travel in a country , how to solve your problems , where is the cheapest accommodation and much more .
Thanks of learning another language , you can have also friends from all over the world and you can better understand the culture of a new country .
And what are the drawbacks ?
It can be really interrupting if it still continues .
And sometimes maybe you do not want to hear what are people speaking about in a foreign language .
In conclusion I would like to say that the learning of another language will be always important for today 's people and the new generation too , and in addition , it will increase need to communicate in another language .

The home of the future .
But why ?
Will they fly in the sky ?
Or will they be made from iron and have a strong door and barred windows ?
Will we even go out on the street ?
Technology will control our homes .
Our bed will tell us when to go to sleep .
I have only one question .
Will we live in that house alone ?
Do we need friends or family members if technology can take care of us ?
Does it mean that contact between people will disappear ?
People use machines and robots because they do n't want to waste their time .

Better live in a cottage .

Writing task : Informal letter
Dear Jenny ,
How are you doing ?
As you know , I 'm planning to go to England to brush up on my English .
I would really appreciate it if you could give me a piece of advice about what course should I take .
Firstly , my main target is to improve my speaking and writing skills , as I do n't feel confident enough to do such tasks .
The selected college should be used to teaching these matters properly .
Secondly , I 'd like the college to be located not too far from accommodation if possible . I would n't like to spend too much time on public transport every day .
As far as accommodation is concern , I 'd like bed and breakfast included in the price .
Would it be enough for a two - week course in England ?
If it 's not , please let me know .
Well , we 'll keep in touch and thank you very much for all your help .
Best regards
Juan

In my opinion , to be a suitable person for the summer camp job you should have qualifications to create fun activities and to keep kids safe .
As a father of three boys and one girl aged 7 - 10 years , I have the ability to create and perform fun activities .
In the last summer , my kids and I created a fun morning and afternoon program for our neighbors . We called it " multi - balls multi - fun " .
In the morning program , the kids have enjoyed playing football , soccer ball , basketball and water ball .
The program has included many competitive activities that were full of fun and cheerful .
the kids have loved learning new dances and cultures .
Safety is a core component in the summer camps ' activities .
As a retired nurse , I have a high sense of safety and harm prevention .
In conclusion , I think providing fun in a safe environment is the main component in summer camp that each family is looking for . as a father and a nurse I have the ability to create the fun , to provide safe activities , and the most important is my ability to intervene in the emergency situations .

Yet , to me , public transport is my
preference .
going to work or travelling by car .

Tom was so happy because he had finally won the prize .
Three consecutive years he attended in the local race , but at most he could get the second rank .
This year he found a good trainer and 6 months ' training made him fully ready for this race .
He went to a coffee shop .
The old man said to him " my son needs surgery today or he will die " .
Tom asked him the cost of the surgery .
Tom told him " I can give you 5000 $ but what can I do for the rest of this amount ?
He thought I should perform a show to jump over the several wrecked cars , but it was too risky because he had not had any experience in this kind of show .
He talked to his trainer Jack and explained the problem .
Jack said , " I know someone who can do that but how will we organize the show .
We need advertising and to find a suitable place for the show until 3 pm " .
Tom yelled : " ladies and gentlemen , please help us as much as you can because all of the income of this show is paid for the surgery of a sick boy " .
Tom sold all of the tickets quickly and earned enough money .
His son was cured and in the recovery room . Tom visited him and they became friends .
It was 10 pm when Tom arrived home .

Good morning , everyone !
Today I 'm going to introduce a book about nature that I 've read recently .
The book is called " Living Through a Natural Disaster " , written by Eve Recht .
The reason I chose this book was that it is really comprehensive in showing you that different parts of the world are suffering from disasters , for instance , the Cyclone Tracy in Darwin , Australia ; the Yellow River flood in China and a devastating drought in Central America , etc .
It concisely depicts the devastation and destruction caused by natural disasters .
At the beginning , the Yellow River was always unleashing terrible floods that swept through towns , villages and farmland .
People were forced to flee by boat because of the flood .
People living along the river wanted to prevent the flood coming again by building dykes .
However , it made the situation worse .
After day of heavy rain , the water level became dangerously high because the riverbed can not withstand the water when it is out of its limitation .
Now , she is extremely angry after human beings did something really hurt to her .
After all , she is very kind - hearted and always helps us to have a good living .
However , " it was the worst of times " also .
The Yellow River is a combination of history and modernization .
It carries a lot of memories from the past to now , whether it is cruel to people or not .
Reading this book is like unwrapping a present which is packed in layers of sheets .
Meanwhile , a surge of sympathy and despair overwhelmed me with lots of thought - provoking words .
That 's all for my presentation today .
Thank you for listening !
I agree with the idea that sporting events can be necessary for international relations and national unity .
In this essay , I will think about the effects of these popular sporting events .
The World Cup , the Olympics and other international games work for easing tensions among different nations .
For example , North and South Korea are two countries who are against each other , but every year they still have a friendly football match .
During that time , the fans and the players are the same harmony in unity and friendship .
On the other hand , some sports matches can make international relations worse .
The patriotic emotions explode in an unaggressive way .
For example , during the semi - final first leg AFF Cup 2014 between Vietnam and Malaysia team , the players played quite violent , and the supporters of the two teams were very tense .
Even after the end of the match , assaults occurred between supporters of the two teams .
I think that international sporting occasions can be one of the best ways to ease tensions or to release patriotism safely .
However , I believe that games can not be the fundamental ways for the sound patriotism or peaceful international relations .

People 's lives will change dramatically in the next 50 years .
If we watch how society is going nowadays , we notice some aspects that let us think about the human condition .
First of all , we can define ourselves as " slaves of the technology " , because now we all have a telephone that have lots of functions and that turn us away from real life .
This can be seen in teenagers , who seems to prefer to talk by telephone than " face to face " , and also in children , who prefer play with video games on their own than going to the park .
In my opinion , the obsession for the business trasforms society in a ring in which every man will be against his friend only for the sake of an excellent career .
In this way , everyone is the perfect copy of someone else and the originality or a creative mind is considered as something bad .
There are also positive aspects , for example , there is a progress in the subject of medicine or in the use of the eco - resources .
Yes , it will , and I hope that we will improve our thought and we will have the cosciousness that we are not " supreme " and that we will never have the right of imposing us in the world .
Nowadays , it is possible to listen to various types of music .
What is the reason for making music necessary for us ?
Is national music more important than foreign music , which is heard all over the world ?
Taking acceptance the strength of music , it is hard to imagine human life without it . "
Music is the nutrition for our souls " it said in the popular proverb .
Therefore , we can feel the enormous role of music in our lives .
To my mind , the beautifulness of music does not depend on its sorts .
People enjoy it and do not think about its genre .
For example , there are various music competitions Eurovision Song Contest which are organized in many countries .
Being at the core of the culture of a country , it influences on national fame .
For instance , in our country , music consists of two main parts : Mougam and Folk music , which have been getting popularity from all regions in the world since it was sprung .
Despite the fact that it is held by the majority of countries .
To take account that it has been improving day by day , we can meet the appearance of very exotic and amazing mixtures of modern and national music almost in every country .
Inasmuch as this process makes peoples close to each other , encouraging them to corporate and befriend .
It is essential to treasure music as one of the significant kinds of art .
Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her .
But to begin with , Anna for a long time was n't famous at school .
She prefer books , quiet places and that kind of thing , which was boring for the elite in our school .
She was very focused on learning .
She had a dream to be a lawyer and wanted to help innocent people .
One a day , she decided to pass away all of this thing and get started on something completely different .
She forgot about books .
Unfashionable clothes turned into fashionable dresses .
Anna became a model !
And for now , she is one of the most popular models in the world , not only in the school .
The day when Anna decided to be a model was the most important in her life .
